cheatsheetvideos.quote: Karla only needed to Study for 1 hour. She then went to the DMV and Passed her test
DMV Test Cheat Sheet: John Tells us How to Ace The Driver’s Test On your First Try

questions.question: Worn or bald tires:
questions.answerA: Can make turning more difficult.
questions.answerB: Are likely to hydroplane.
questions.answerC: Can increase your stopping distance.
questions.explanation: Worn or bald tires can increase your stopping distance and make turning more difficult. Tires without adequate tread also increase the risk of hydroplaning.

questions.question: You may pass a school bus from the front or rear on an undivided roadway:
questions.answerA: Under no circumstances.
questions.answerB: When the red lamps on the school bus are flashing.
questions.answerC: When the red lamps on the school bus are not flashing.
questions.answerD: At anytime, if you drive slowly.
questions.explanation: You may not pass a school bus on an undivided highway from either direction while the school bus is using its flashing red lights. If there are no flashing red lights, you may pass normally.

questions.question: If two drivers arrive at the same time to a four-way intersection controlled by stop signs:
questions.answerA: The driver on the right has the right-of-way.
questions.answerB: The driver on the left has the right-of-way.
questions.answerC: One driver may continue driving without stopping.
questions.answerD: One driver should honk to indicate that they are giving up the right-of-way.
questions.explanation: Yield the right-of-way to the driver on your right at a four-way intersection if you both arrive to the intersection at the same time. You may then proceed when it is safe to do so.

questions.question: When towing a trailer or a house trailer, you should:
questions.answerA: Have someone ride in the trailer to keep the load steady.
questions.answerB: Allow only adults to ride in the trailer.
questions.answerC: Never allow anyone to ride in the trailer.
questions.answerD: Allow people to ride in house trailers only.
questions.explanation: You should not permit passengers to ride in trailers. Riding in trailers of any kind is prohibited.

questions.question: If a transit vehicle is signaling to re-enter the main roadway following a stop, you must:
questions.answerA: Honk to let them know you’re there.
questions.answerB: Move to the left lane.
questions.answerC: Yield.
questions.explanation: You must yield to any transit vehicle that is signaling to pull back onto the main roadway after it has stopped to load or unload passengers. Change lanes, slow down, or stop to allow the bus safe re-entry into traffic.

questions.question: This sign means that:
questions.answerA: A community service group is picking up trash along the highway ahead.
questions.answerB: Workers are on or very close to the road in the work zone ahead.
questions.answerC: Children are at play ahead.
questions.answerD: There is a pedestrian crosswalk ahead.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that workers may be on or very close to the roadway ahead, so you should take special care when traveling through the area.

questions.question: You are driving in the left lane and want to move into the right lane. You should:
questions.answerA: Check your mirrors, signal, and look over your left shoulder for other vehicles before changing lanes.
questions.answerB: Check your mirrors, signal, and look over your right shoulder for other vehicles before changing lanes.
questions.answerC: Check your mirrors, signal, and look over both shoulders for other vehicles before changing lanes.
questions.answerD: Check your mirrors, signal, and change lanes.
questions.explanation: When changing lanes, you should check your vehicle's blind spots by looking over your shoulder in the direction that you want to move. Always check your mirrors and turn on your directional signal before beginning a lane change.

questions.question: The most important thing in any driving situation is:
questions.answerA: The vehicle.
questions.answerB: The environment.
questions.answerC: The driver.
questions.explanation: Every driving situation involves three basic elements: the environment, the vehicle, and the driver. Of these three elements, only you as a driver have the ability to gather information about the existing situation. Apply your skills, knowledge, experience, and judgment, and take any action required to safely complete the driving task.

questions.question: Increase your following distance when:
questions.answerA: Driving behind a large vehicle that blocks your vision.
questions.answerB: Exiting an expressway.
questions.answerC: Following a motorcycle.
questions.explanation: You should increase your following distance when you are behind a large vehicle that blocks your vision, when driving in bad weather or heavy traffic, when exiting an expressway, when behind a motorcycle or bicycle, and if someone is tailgating you.

questions.question: Coming to a complete stop at an intersection, yielding to cross traffic/pedestrians, and then proceeding through the intersection when the way is clear corresponds with:
questions.answerA: A solid red light.
questions.answerB: A flashing yellow light.
questions.answerC: A solid green light.
questions.explanation: A flashing red traffic light means the same thing as a stop sign. You must come to a complete stop, yield to cross traffic and pedestrians, and then proceed when the way is clear.

questions.question: You and another vehicle are approaching an intersection that has no traffic signs or signals. Which vehicle has the right-of-way?
questions.answerA: The vehicle on the left
questions.answerB: The vehicle on the right
questions.answerC: The biggest vehicle
questions.answerD: The vehicle that enters the intersection first
questions.explanation: The vehicle on the right has the right-of-way when two vehicles arrive to an uncontrolled intersection at the same time. When the first driver has safely passed through the intersection, the other driver may proceed.

questions.question: Certain highway signs contain information about hazardous conditions. Such signs are known as:
questions.answerA: Regulatory signs.
questions.answerB: Warning signs.
questions.answerC: Information signs.
questions.explanation: Warning signs advise drivers of potentially hazardous conditions. For your own safety, obey warning signs. Disregarding the information provided by a warning sign may result in an accident due to your negligence.

questions.question: When entering a street from a driveway, you:
questions.answerA: Must drive slowly to allow approaching vehicles and pedestrians time to get out of your way.
questions.answerB: Must honk your horn so approaching vehicles and pedestrians know to give you room.
questions.answerC: Must stop and proceed only when there are no pedestrians or vehicles approaching.
questions.answerD: Can disregard any pedestrians if there is no sidewalk.
questions.explanation: Always stop before entering the roadway from a driveway and yield to any approaching vehicles or crossing pedestrians. The stop should be made before crossing the sidewalk area. Failure to stop is unlawful.

questions.question: A diamond-shaped sign:
questions.answerA: Warns of existing or possible hazards.
questions.answerB: Alerts drivers to school zones.
questions.answerC: Alerts drivers to public recreation areas.
questions.answerD: Alerts drivers to upcoming food and gas locations.
questions.explanation: Diamond-shaped signs warn drivers of existing or potential driving hazards. You will usually see these signs in yellow or orange.

questions.question: Newer vehicles are equipped with a brake warning lamp on the instrument panel. This lamp:
questions.answerA: Should come on when the parking brake is released.
questions.answerB: Comes on to indicate that the brake system is defective.
questions.answerC: Will never come on.
questions.answerD: Comes on to indicate that the brake lights are operational.
questions.explanation: The brake warning lamp should go out when the parking brake is released. If it illuminates when the foot brake pedal is pressed, the brake system is defective and the vehicle should not be driven.

questions.question: It is important to be alert to motorcycles because:
questions.answerA: They are more difficult to see than cars.
questions.answerB: They rarely use their headlights.
questions.answerC: Motorcyclists are less skilled drivers than other motorists.
questions.explanation: Motorcycles are smaller and harder to see than cars. Because of their size, they are easily hidden in a car’s blind spot. It may be difficult to judge your distance to a motorcycle and difficult to tell how fast a motorcycle is moving, so always be alert and extra cautious when near a motorcyclist.

questions.question: Safety belts:
questions.answerA: Should be worn at all times when driving or riding in a vehicle.
questions.answerB: Should be worn only when traveling at high speeds.
questions.answerC: Should be worn loosely.
questions.answerD: Can only prevent drivers from injury.
questions.explanation: Safety belts are life belts. They must be worn at all times when driving or riding in a vehicle. They are the most important personal safety item available in any vehicle.

questions.question: When changing lanes on a highway, you should:
questions.answerA: Signal a lane change.
questions.answerB: Check your rearview and outside mirrors.
questions.answerC: Check your blind spot by glancing over your shoulder.
questions.explanation: Any time you want to change lanes, you should properly signal your intentions well in advance, check your mirrors, and check your blind spot. You can check your blind spot by glancing over your shoulder in the direction that you plan to move.

questions.question: An arrogant driver is a driver who:
questions.answerA: Is purposely in a hurry and competing with other traffic.
questions.answerB: Shows little or no respect for traffic laws or the rights of other drivers and pedestrians.
questions.answerC: You should try to avoid while driving.
questions.explanation: An arrogant driver is purposely in a hurry and competing with other drivers sharing the road. Arrogant drivers have little or no respect for traffic laws or the rights of other drivers and pedestrians. Never allow yourself to become involved in competition with an arrogant driver.

questions.question: When driving on an interstate:
questions.answerA: Stop on the shoulder of the road if you are tired.
questions.answerB: You should always use cruise control.
questions.answerC: Signal, check mirrors, and check blind spots before changing lanes.
questions.explanation: Signal, check your mirrors, and check your blind spot before changing lanes or passing on an interstate. Only stop on the shoulder of the interstate in the case of an emergency and change lanes as infrequently as possible. Cruise control should not be used in heavy traffic or under poor weather conditions.

questions.question: Defensive driving is:
questions.answerA: Identifying dangerous driving situations and taking action to avoid accidents.
questions.answerB: Defending yourself against poor drivers by getting ahead of them in traffic.
questions.answerC: Following the vehicle ahead of you at a close distance.
questions.answerD: Quickly changing lanes and shifting in and out of traffic congestion.
questions.explanation: You drive defensively when you identify dangerous driving situations and take action before an accident occurs. Defensive driving helps prevent conflicts with aggressive, offensive, discourteous, careless, inattentive, impulsive, ignorant, or intoxicated drivers or pedestrians.

questions.question: When making a turn, you must ____ your speed.
questions.answerA: Increase
questions.answerB: Maintain
questions.answerC: Vary
questions.explanation: When turning, you should reduce to a speed that allows you to maintain control of your vehicle, stay in your lane, and react to unexpected situations.

questions.question: If you leave your vehicle unattended, you must:
questions.answerA: Turn off the engine.
questions.answerB: Lock the ignition and remove the key.
questions.answerC: Set the parking brake.
questions.explanation: When you leave your vehicle unattended, you must stop the engine, lock the ignition, remove the key from the ignition, and set the parking brake.

questions.question: Pentagonal signs indicate:
questions.answerA: No passing zones.
questions.answerB: School zones.
questions.answerC: Speed limits.
questions.explanation: Pentagonal signs indicate that you are in a school zone. Be extra alert to children and pedestrians when driving near a school.

questions.question: You are driving on a busy street and your vehicle’s accelerator sticks open. You should:
questions.answerA: Blow your horn.
questions.answerB: Slam on your brakes.
questions.answerC: Turn on your four-way flashers.
questions.answerD: Turn off your ignition, taking care not to engage the steering wheel locking mechanism.
questions.explanation: If your vehicle’s accelerator sticks open, your vehicle will continue to maintain its speed or accelerate, even if you remove your foot from the gas pedal. Turn off the ignition, using care to move the ignition switch only far enough to stop the engine and not engage the steering wheel locking mechanism. Apply your brakes and move off the road to a safe area.

questions.question: A driver should be extra alert to motorcyclists, bicyclists, and pedestrians because:
questions.answerA: They’re difficult to see in traffic.
questions.answerB: They obey different traffic laws than larger motor vehicles.
questions.answerC: They always have the right-of-way.
questions.explanation: In many collisions with motorcycles, bicycles, and pedestrians, drivers reported that they were looking but still did not see the smaller vehicle or pedestrian. These can be more difficult to spot in traffic than passenger vehicles because they are smaller, may move faster, and have less noticeable lighting. To prevent collisions with these smaller and less protected road users, drivers should always be alert to the presence of motorcycles, bikes, and pedestrians.

questions.question: The amount of space you need to cross traffic depends on the:
questions.answerA: Road conditions, weather conditions, and oncoming traffic.
questions.answerB: Presence of a stop sign.
questions.answerC: Use of your turn signals.
questions.explanation: The amount of space you need to cross traffic depends on the road conditions, weather conditions, and oncoming traffic.

questions.question: What does a single dashed white line separating traffic mean?
questions.answerA: Drivers may pass, even if it could be dangerous.
questions.answerB: Lanes move in opposite directions.
questions.answerC: Drivers may not pass.
questions.answerD: Drivers may pass if it is safe to do so.
questions.explanation: White lines separate lanes of traffic that are moving in the same direction. Dashed white lines may be crossed to pass or change lanes, if it is safe to do so.

questions.question: A driver entering public traffic from a driveway or private road:
questions.answerA: Has the right-of-way.
questions.answerB: Should yield to drivers already on the public road.
questions.answerC: May force their way into traffic.
questions.answerD: Can assume that other drivers will change lanes to make room.
questions.explanation: If you are entering traffic from a driveway or private road, you should yield to drivers already on the public road. Merge safely into traffic when you are able to do so.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: All traffic must turn right.
questions.answerB: No right turn.
questions.answerC: All traffic must go straight ahead.
questions.answerD: A road joins from the right.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that there is an intersection ahead. A road joins from the right.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: No U-turn.
questions.answerB: No turning.
questions.answerC: No left turn.
questions.explanation: This sign prohibits U-turns. Do not make a U-turn where this sign is posted.

questions.question: You notice that the driver in the vehicle ahead of you is driving with one hand and talking to a passenger. You should:
questions.answerA: Give the vehicle extra space.
questions.answerB: Know that the driver in the vehicle ahead is reducing their safety margin by being an inattentive driver.
questions.answerC: Avoid following the driver's example.
questions.explanation: Do not become distracted by looking at passengers, attempting to find something in your vehicle, looking at reading material, sightseeing, or daydreaming while driving. If a driver near you seems distracted, allow them extra space because the risk of an accident is increased by their inattentiveness.

questions.question: The mechanical condition of a vehicle is the responsibility of:
questions.answerA: The legal owner of the vehicle.
questions.answerB: The garage mechanic.
questions.answerC: The vehicle driver.
questions.explanation: You are responsible for the condition of the vehicle you are driving, even if you are not the owner of the vehicle. General care and maintenance should be performed regularly on every vehicle.

questions.question: You notice a vehicle defect which may affect the safe operation of your vehicle. You should:
questions.answerA: Correct the defect as soon as possible.
questions.answerB: Correct the defect when you can afford it.
questions.answerC: Drive the vehicle at slower speeds.
questions.explanation: Any defect that may affect the safe operation of a vehicle should be corrected as soon as possible. Defects should be corrected before the vehicle is driven.

questions.question: A police officer directs you to drive through a red light. What should you do?
questions.answerA: Stop and then proceed.
questions.answerB: Wait for the green light.
questions.answerC: Proceed as directed by the officer.
questions.explanation: You must obey all lawful orders and directions given by police officers. If a police officer indicates that you should continue through a red light, follow the instruction.

questions.question: A solid white line down the center of a two-lane road indicates:
questions.answerA: Lanes are moving in opposite directions and drivers are not permitted to pass.
questions.answerB: Lanes are moving in opposite directions and drivers are permitted to pass when it is safe to do so.
questions.answerC: Lanes are moving in the same direction and drivers are not permitted to pass.
questions.answerD: Lanes are moving in the same direction and drivers are permitted to pass when it is safe to do so.
questions.explanation: White lines are used to separate traffic moving in the same direction. Solid lines indicate that drivers are not permitted to pass.

questions.question: What should you do when an emergency vehicle is approaching while displaying flashing red or blue lights?
questions.answerA: See if you can reach your destination before the emergency vehicle catches up to you.
questions.answerB: Continue driving but try to stay out of its way.
questions.answerC: Pull over to the side of the road and come to a complete stop.
questions.answerD: Stop in the middle of an intersection.
questions.explanation: You must yield the right-of-way to all emergency vehicles using a siren, air horn, and/or flashing red, blue, or white lights. Where possible, you must pull over to the right edge of the road. If you are in an intersection, drive through the intersection before you pull over.

questions.question: The consumption of alcohol while taking drugs can:
questions.answerA: Decrease the effects of the drugs and alcohol.
questions.answerB: Increase the effects of both the drugs and alcohol.
questions.answerC: Help cure your illness.
questions.explanation: The combination of alcohol and drugs, in some cases, can increase the effects of both the drugs and alcohol. It can be unsafe to drive after consuming either alcohol or drugs and is even more dangerous after combining them.

questions.question: A flashing red traffic signal at an intersection has the same requirements as:
questions.answerA: A slow sign.
questions.answerB: A yield sign.
questions.answerC: A stop sign.
questions.explanation: When approaching a flashing red signal, you must stop and yield to all traffic that does not have to stop.

questions.question: You must stop at a railroad crossing when:
questions.answerA: Directed to do so by a flagger.
questions.answerB: It is controlled by a stop sign.
questions.answerC: Flashing red signals and gates are present and operating.
questions.explanation: You must stop at a railroad crossing when directed to do so by a flagger or stop sign. Stop when flashing red signals and gates are present and operating.

questions.question: When towing a trailer, you must make sure that:
questions.answerA: The trailer has a safety chain securely attached to the trailer hitch.
questions.answerB: The trailer has a safety chain securely attached to the vehicle’s bumper.
questions.answerC: The trailer has a safety chain securely attached to the frame of the towing vehicle.
questions.answerD: The trailer hitch is equipped with a fail-safe latch.
questions.explanation: Your trailer must be equipped with safety chains. Safety chains must be attached to the frame of the towing vehicle and the trailer. They should not be connected to a part of the trailer hitch.

questions.question: To practice defensive driving, you should:
questions.answerA: Be aware of developing traffic situations around you.
questions.answerB: Consistently look well ahead of your vehicle and maintain proper following distances.
questions.answerC: Have an alternate plan of action ready.
questions.explanation: Be a defensive driver by looking well ahead of your vehicle and anticipating chain reaction traffic situations. Always have an alternate plan of action ready in case an unexpected event develops. Always maintain the proper following distance and speed for road conditions.

questions.question: Always signal when:
questions.answerA: Changing lanes.
questions.answerB: Pulling into or out of a parking space.
questions.answerC: Pulling into traffic from an alley or parking area.
questions.explanation: Always use the proper turn signal when changing lanes, pulling into or out of a parking space, or pulling into traffic from an alley or parking area. Communicate with other drivers on the road to help prevent accidents.

questions.question: On a two-lane street, your vehicle is being followed by a fire engine that is not using its emergency signals. You should:
questions.answerA: Continue to drive in a normal manner.
questions.answerB: Stop as quickly as you can.
questions.answerC: Speed up to get out of its way.
questions.answerD: Slow down, move as far to the right as possible, and stop.
questions.explanation: If you are being followed by an emergency vehicle that is not using its siren or flashing lights, you do not need to clear a path. Continue driving in a normal manner.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Slippery when wet.
questions.answerB: Tow-away zone.
questions.answerC: Steep downgrade.
questions.explanation: Warning signs prepare drivers for upcoming road conditions and hazards and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign tells drivers to be cautious when driving under conditions that may cause the roadway to become wet and slippery.

questions.question: While driving, you come upon a sign displaying the words “Reduced speed, 35 mph." This means:
questions.answerA: That the new 35 mph speed limit begins at this sign.
questions.answerB: That the new 35 mph speed limit begins at the next speed limit sign.
questions.answerC: That you have plenty of time to slow down before the reduced speed zone.
questions.answerD: That you should reduce your speed to 35 mph, but only under poor weather conditions.
questions.explanation: "Reduced speed" signs inform drivers that they must reduce their speeds. If a new speed limit is posted on one of these signs, the new speed limit begins at the sign.

questions.question: When driving near heavy trucks, other drivers and highway users must make allowances for:
questions.answerA: The increased stopping distance required by large vehicles.
questions.answerB: The decreased stopping distance required by large vehicles.
questions.answerC: The decreased noise of larger vehicles.
questions.answerD: The increased speed of larger vehicles.
questions.explanation: When driving near heavy trucks, other drivers and highway users must make allowances for the increased stopping distance required by the large vehicles. Drivers of smaller vehicles should remain in locations where they can be seen by the driver of the large vehicle and where their view of traffic is not blocked by the vehicle.

questions.question: A yellow light that flashes on and off means:
questions.answerA: Stop and look for other vehicles, then go if there is no traffic.
questions.answerB: Stop and wait for a green light.
questions.answerC: Speed up to clear the intersection quickly.
questions.answerD: Slow down and proceed with caution.
questions.explanation: A flashing yellow traffic light means drivers should slow down and proceed with caution.

questions.question: As a pedestrian, you should:
questions.answerA: Look for turning vehicles before crossing a street.
questions.answerB: Never run alongside or across a street.
questions.answerC: Walk on the left side of the street, facing traffic.
questions.explanation: As a pedestrian, do not run alongside or across a street. Walk on the left side of the street, facing oncoming traffic. Always look for turning vehicles before crossing a street.

questions.question: When a vehicle with an Anti-Lock Braking System starts to lose traction on a slippery road, drivers should:
questions.answerA: Pump the brakes.
questions.answerB: Press and hold the brake pedal.
questions.answerC: Press and hold the gas pedal.
questions.explanation: If their vehicle loses traction on a slippery road, a driver with an Anti-Lock Braking System (ABS) needs to press down hard on the brake pedal, hold it, and steer out of danger. In an emergency situation, the ABS automatically pumps the brakes at a faster rate than the driver could. Removing steady pressure from the brake pedal or pumping the brakes will disengage the ABS.

questions.question: What should you do when you are going to enter a roadway from a private road?
questions.answerA: Blow your horn to warn cars you are entering the roadway.
questions.answerB: Stop with part of your car on the roadway to alert other drivers.
questions.answerC: Drive out fast to merge smoothly with the traffic.
questions.answerD: Yield the right-of-way to pedestrians and roadway traffic.
questions.explanation: When entering a roadway from a driveway or private road, you must yield the right-of-way to pedestrians and traffic on the roadway.

questions.question: As a pedestrian, you should:
questions.answerA: Always insist on the right-of-way over a vehicle when using a crosswalk.
questions.answerB: Never enter a street or crosswalk when vehicles are approaching.
questions.answerC: Enter a crosswalk at any time because it is the vehicle driver’s responsibility to stop.
questions.answerD: Use crosswalks only if they are convenient.
questions.explanation: Pedestrians should not enter a street or crosswalk when vehicles are approaching. Though pedestrians have the right-of-way in crosswalks, a vehicle approaching from a close distance may not have the time to stop before entering the crosswalk.

questions.question: What may help drivers conserve gasoline?
questions.answerA: Sitting in their driveways with their cars running.
questions.answerB: Accelerating quickly.
questions.answerC: Slowing down gradually.
questions.explanation: Every time you have to stop quickly, it takes time and fuel to accelerate and get your vehicle back up to the speed of traffic. Drivers who look far ahead of their vehicles can slow down gradually or change lanes to avoid unnecessary braking, leading to better gas mileage.

questions.question: You may honk your horn when you:
questions.answerA: Have to stop quickly.
questions.answerB: Are passing another car.
questions.answerC: Have lost control of your car.
questions.explanation: One situation where it is appropriate to use your horn is if you lose control of your vehicle. In this case, sound your horn to alert other drivers.

questions.question: A leaky exhaust system in your vehicle is dangerous because it can cause:
questions.answerA: A loss of hearing.
questions.answerB: Pollution.
questions.answerC: Carbon monoxide poisoning.
questions.explanation: The exhaust system carries exhaust gas out of the vehicle and prevents fumes from entering into the passenger compartment. To prevent carbon monoxide poisoning, keep your exhaust system free of leaks. Replace all defective parts immediately.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: No parking.
questions.answerB: Divided highway ahead.
questions.answerC: Left turn signal.
questions.explanation: Regulation signs regulate traffic speed and movement, displaying rules which drivers must obey. This regulation sign indicates that parking is not permitted.

questions.question: Alcoholic beverages will affect you:
questions.answerA: More rapidly after you have just eaten.
questions.answerB: More rapidly on an empty stomach.
questions.answerC: In the same way at all times.
questions.answerD: Only if you have more than two drinks.
questions.explanation: Alcohol can affect you differently at different times. Any amount of alcohol consumed on an empty stomach will affect you more rapidly than it does when you have just eaten. It is safest to refrain from driving when you have consumed alcohol in any quantity.

questions.question: When towing a trailer, ensure that it is equipped with:
questions.answerA: Properly mounted and lubricated wheels that are covered with fenders or mud guards.
questions.answerB: Tires that are properly inflated.
questions.answerC: The proper lamps and reflectors.
questions.explanation: The wheels of a trailer should be properly mounted and lubricated and must be covered with fenders or mud guards. A trailer should have good tires that are properly inflated. It should be equipped with the proper lamps and reflectors.

questions.question: You have been charged with driving under the influence of alcohol and have refused to take the required chemical test. You may lose your driver license for twelve months:
questions.answerA: Only if you are convicted of driving while under the influence of alcohol.
questions.answerB: Only if you are convicted of a traffic violation.
questions.answerC: Because you have refused to take the test.
questions.explanation: Any person operating a motor vehicle in Hawaii consents to having their blood alcohol content (BAC) tested when requested by law enforcement. Refusing to take a chemical test will result in the revocation of your license for a minimum of one year.

questions.question: When you see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights, you must:
questions.answerA: Slow down and keep moving in your lane.
questions.answerB: Keep driving in your lane.
questions.answerC: Pull to the right curb and stop.
questions.explanation: When you see an emergency vehicle using its lights or hear it using its siren, you must immediately pull over to the curb or side of the road and stop.

questions.question: You want to turn left at an intersection. The light is green but oncoming traffic is heavy. You should:
questions.answerA: Use the next intersection.
questions.answerB: Wait at the crosswalk for traffic to clear.
questions.answerC: Wait in the center of the intersection for traffic to clear.
questions.answerD: Take the right-of-way since you have a green light.
questions.explanation: When making a left turn where there is approaching traffic, you must wait for the approaching traffic to go through before you turn. You may enter the intersection to prepare for your left turn if the light is green and no other vehicle ahead of you plans to make a left turn.

questions.question: If your turn signals fail, you should use ____ to indicate that you are turning.
questions.answerA: Your horn
questions.answerB: Your headlights
questions.answerC: Hand signals
questions.explanation: If your vehicle's turn signals do not work, you should use hand signals to indicate when you intend to change direction.

questions.question: Work zone signs mean:
questions.answerA: It is summer.
questions.answerB: You must immediately stop and back up.
questions.answerC: Less than ideal conditions are present for driving.
questions.answerD: You should drive faster to get out of the work zone.
questions.explanation: Work zone signs are orange and indicate that some type of work is being performed on or alongside the roadway. Be extremely careful when you see these signs.

questions.question: The driver's left arm and hand are extended downward. This hand signal means that the driver plans to:
questions.answerA: Turn left.
questions.answerB: Turn right.
questions.answerC: Stop.
questions.explanation: If a driver's left arm and hand are extended downward, they are indicating that they intend to stop. Adjust your driving accordingly if following a driver who is using this hand signal.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: Intersection ahead.
questions.answerB: Steep grade ahead.
questions.answerC: Winding road.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that a steep downhill grade is ahead.

questions.question: You may drive around the gates at a railroad crossing:
questions.answerA: When the train has passed.
questions.answerB: Under no circumstances.
questions.answerC: When the lights have stopped flashing.
questions.answerD: When other drivers drive around the gates.
questions.explanation: You are required to stop at all railroad crossings when signals warn of an approaching train. These signals may include flashing red lights, a lowered crossing gate, a flagger signaling, or a train’s audible signal of warning. Do not attempt to go around a lowered gate.

questions.question: Smoking and preparing to smoke while driving:
questions.answerA: Do not affect driving abilities.
questions.answerB: Help maintain driver alertness.
questions.answerC: Are distracting activities.
questions.explanation: Smoking while driving can create dangerous distractions by causing you to take your hands off the wheel and/or your eyes off the road.

questions.question: A steady yellow light at an intersection means:
questions.answerA: Go.
questions.answerB: Yield to other cars.
questions.answerC: Slow down and prepare to stop.
questions.explanation: A steady yellow light indicates that a steady red light will soon appear. If you are driving toward an intersection and a yellow light appears, slow down and prepare to stop. If you are already within the intersection or cannot stop safely before entering the intersection, continue through carefully.

questions.question: Drinking coffee after drinking alcohol:
questions.answerA: Decreases blood alcohol concentration.
questions.answerB: Cancels the effect of the alcohol.
questions.answerC: Has no effect on blood alcohol concentration.
questions.explanation: Drinking coffee will not reduce your blood alcohol concentration (BAC). While it may help you to stay awake, it cannot change your BAC or make you sober.

questions.question: Signaling your intentions before turning, changing lanes, or driving away from a curb:
questions.answerA: Is necessary only if other traffic is present.
questions.answerB: Is a good driving habit and is required by law.
questions.answerC: Is necessary only during the maneuver, not before.
questions.answerD: Is not necessary if the maneuver is done slowly.
questions.explanation: When changing lanes or turning, signal your intentions well in advance. The law requires that you signal for at least 100 feet before you move your vehicle to the right or left. Before pulling away from a curb, always signal to inform passing drivers of your intentions.

questions.question: All headlights on your vehicle must work properly and be correctly adjusted:
questions.answerA: Only when you plan to drive in a city.
questions.answerB: At all times.
questions.answerC: Only when driving on freeways.
questions.explanation: Your vehicle's headlights are critical to safely driving during the night, in rainy weather, in fog, and through tunnels. They must work properly and be correctly adjusted at all times.

questions.question: When you see other drivers around you acting or reacting in anger:
questions.answerA: Don’t make eye contact.
questions.answerB: Don't react with hand gestures.
questions.answerC: Distance yourself from the situation.
questions.explanation: When other drivers are behaving angrily, you should take action to physically and mentally distance yourself from the situation. Avoid making eye contact with them, or making body movements or gestures that could provoke them. Slow down, move over, or do whatever you safely can to put yourself out of danger.

questions.question: When two vehicles arrive to an intersection at the same time, which one has the right-of-way when no signs or signals indicate rules?
questions.answerA: The car approaching from the right has the right-of-way.
questions.answerB: The car approaching from the left has the right-of-way.
questions.answerC: The car in which the driver sounds his horn first has the right-of-way.
questions.answerD: The car that is traveling the fastest has the right-of-way.
questions.explanation: At an intersection of two similar roads without a traffic control device, a driver must yield to a vehicle approaching from the right.

questions.question: You are driving at night and another vehicle is approaching from the opposite direction. Your headlights:
questions.answerA: Should be on their high beam setting.
questions.answerB: Should be on their low beam setting.
questions.answerC: Should be off. Use your parking lights.
questions.answerD: May be on either their high or low beam setting.
questions.explanation: Do not use your high beam headlights when approaching or following another vehicle at night. Switch to the low beam setting to ensure the safety of everyone on the road.

questions.question: When the driver behind you wants to pass, you should:
questions.answerA: Speed up.
questions.answerB: Go the same speed.
questions.answerC: Slow down to allow room in front of your vehicle for the other driver to complete the pass easily.
questions.explanation: When the driver behind you wants to pass, you should slow down so that there is enough room in front of your vehicle for the other driver to complete their pass. This will allow them to complete the passing maneuver in less time and more easily.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Slow down if an emergency vehicle is approaching.
questions.answerB: Look both ways as you cross the intersection.
questions.answerC: Always come to a full stop at the intersection.
questions.answerD: Slow down and be prepared to stop if necessary.
questions.explanation: Decrease your speed as you approach an intersection with a yield sign. Prepare to stop and yield the right-of-way to vehicles and pedestrians in the intersection or crossroad. You must come to a full stop at a yield sign if traffic conditions require it.

questions.question: When passing a large vehicle, the driver of a small vehicle must be prepared for:
questions.answerA: Loud noises.
questions.answerB: Excess air pollution.
questions.answerC: Wind gusts produced by the large vehicle.
questions.explanation: Large vehicles can cause wind gusts with a force great enough to cause direction changes in smaller vehicles. Drivers of small vehicles should be prepared to take proper corrective steering action when approaching or passing large vehicles that are moving at or near maximum speeds.

questions.question: What can you do to avoid the need to make emergency stops while driving in traffic?
questions.answerA: Honk your horn to make others aware of your presence.
questions.answerB: Look ahead and maintain a safe following distance.
questions.answerC: Drive in the right lane only.
questions.answerD: Drive more slowly than the flow of traffic.
questions.explanation: Keeping a safe following distance will enable you to react to an upcoming problem without the need for a emergency stop, which could cause a driver behind you to crash into the back of your vehicle.

questions.question: When approaching railroad tracks, you should:
questions.answerA: Look, listen, slow down, and be prepared to stop.
questions.answerB: Speed up to cross the tracks before the gate is lowered.
questions.answerC: Try to drive around a lowered gate.
questions.answerD: Not pay attention to how many tracks there are to cross.
questions.explanation: When approaching railroad tracks, you should look, listen, slow down, and be prepared to stop for trains or other vehicles that may be using the rails.

questions.question: Which of the following best ensures your safety and the safety of those around you when you are backing your vehicle?
questions.answerA: Honk your horn right before shifting into reverse.
questions.answerB: Check behind the vehicle before you get into the driver's seat.
questions.answerC: Check your rearview mirrors to see what is behind you.
questions.answerD: Turn up the car radio before backing up to get the attention of anyone who may be around you.
questions.explanation: Backing requires extra caution because it is difficult for drivers to see behind their vehicles. Before entering a vehicle to back up, walk to the back of the vehicle to check for children and small objects.

questions.question: Stop lines are solid white lines painted across traffic lanes:
questions.answerA: In curves and on hills.
questions.answerB: Next to churches and schools.
questions.answerC: At intersections and pedestrian crosswalks.
questions.explanation: Stop lines are solid white lines painted across traffic lanes at intersections and pedestrian crosswalks. They indicate the exact location at which approaching drivers must stop.

questions.question: ____ limit your concentration, perception, judgment, and memory.
questions.answerA: Only a blood alcohol level greater than the legal limit can
questions.answerB: Alcohol does not
questions.answerC: Even the smallest amount of alcohol can
questions.answerD: Only a blood alcohol level greater than 0.05 percent can
questions.explanation: Even the smallest amount of alcohol will reduce your concentration, perception, judgment and memory, and your driving skills will suffer. No one can drink and drive safely.

questions.question: You must stop for a school bus:
questions.answerA: That is parked on the shoulder of the road with no one in it.
questions.answerB: When it approaches you, even if its lights are not flashing.
questions.answerC: If you are both driving on a two-lane highway and its red lights are flashing.
questions.answerD: Whenever the driver waves at you.
questions.explanation: You must stop when approaching a school bus that is displaying flashing red lights while stopped to pick up or drop off children. On a two-lane road, traffic moving in both directions must stop and remain stopped as long as the red lights near the top of the bus are flashing and/or the stop arm on the left side of the bus is extended.

questions.question: A solid yellow “X” over a traffic lane means:
questions.answerA: That drivers must move out of the indicated lane because it is about to be used by oncoming traffic.
questions.answerB: That drivers may drive regularly in the indicated lane.
questions.answerC: That the indicated lane is for left turns only.
questions.answerD: That drivers may use the indicated lane, but should drive with caution.
questions.explanation: Lane use control signals are used when the direction of the flow of traffic in a specific lane changes throughout the day. They are used to show which lanes of traffic are open and closed, as well as to show if toll booths are open or closed. A signal displaying a solid yellow “X” means that drivers must move out of the indicated lane because it is about to be used by oncoming traffic.

questions.question: Bicyclists are required to:
questions.answerA: Obey traffic signs, signals, and laws.
questions.answerB: Ride on the sidewalk in business districts.
questions.answerC: Ride in the center of traffic lanes.
questions.explanation: Bicycles are legally considered vehicles with the same rights and responsibilities as other vehicles. Bicyclists are required to obey all traffic signs, signals, and regulations.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Keep right.
questions.answerB: Low shoulder.
questions.answerC: No parking at any time.
questions.explanation: Regulation signs regulate traffic speed and movement, displaying rules which drivers must obey. This regulation sign indicates that drivers should keep right to avoid an upcoming potential driving hazard.

questions.question: Traffic signals sometimes display arrows to control turns from specific lanes. A solid yellow arrow:
questions.answerA: Is never used as a traffic signal.
questions.answerB: Has the same meaning as a circular yellow traffic light.
questions.answerC: Means that drivers may turn in the direction indicated by the arrow.
questions.answerD: Tells drivers that a green arrow is about to be shown.
questions.explanation: A solid yellow arrow has the same meaning as a yellow traffic light. When approaching a solid yellow arrow, you must reduce your speed and prepare for a red light.

questions.question: At an intersection with a stop sign, you should stop and:
questions.answerA: Check your rearview mirror for cars tailgating.
questions.answerB: Move when the vehicle ahead of you moves.
questions.answerC: Look right first, then left, then right again.
questions.answerD: Look left first, then right, then left again.
questions.explanation: When stopped at an intersection, you should first look to your left, as vehicles coming from the left are closer to you than vehicles coming from the right. Look to your right, then look to your left again, in case there are any vehicles coming from that direction that you did not see at first glance.

questions.question: A double solid yellow line down the center of a two-lane road indicates:
questions.answerA: Lanes are moving in opposite directions and drivers are not permitted to pass.
questions.answerB: Lanes are moving in opposite directions and drivers are permitted to pass when it is safe to do so.
questions.answerC: Lanes are moving in the same direction and drivers are not permitted to pass.
questions.answerD: Lanes are moving in the same direction and drivers are permitted to pass when it is safe to do so.
questions.explanation: Yellow lines are used to separate traffic moving in opposite directions. Solid lines indicate that drivers are not permitted to pass.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: No left turn.
questions.answerB: Flagger ahead.
questions.answerC: Two-way left turn.
questions.explanation: Regulation signs regulate traffic speed and movement, displaying rules which drivers must obey. This regulation sign means that left turns are prohibited.

questions.question: The effect that alcohol has on your reflexes and judgment:
questions.answerA: Is less pronounced when consuming beer instead of wine.
questions.answerB: Is less pronounced when consuming wine instead of beer.
questions.answerC: Is most pronounced when consuming hard ciders and mixed drinks.
questions.answerD: Depends on the amount of alcohol in your bloodstream.
questions.explanation: Consuming any type of alcohol can have negative effects on your reflexes and judgment. It does not matter which type of alcohol is consumed, only how much alcohol has entered a person's bloodstream.

questions.question: To change lanes you should:
questions.answerA: Check your mirrors and signal, then change lanes.
questions.answerB: Signal, check your mirrors, check your blind spot in the direction you plan to move, then change lanes.
questions.answerC: Signal, check your mirrors, and change lanes.
questions.explanation: Before changing lanes, you should activate your turn signal in the appropriate direction and check your rearview and side mirrors. Look over your shoulder in the direction you plan to move in order to check your blind spot and check the far lane to be sure no one else is trying to enter the same lane as you. Change lanes when you are sure it is safe to do so.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Trucks only.
questions.answerB: Trucks are entering the highway.
questions.answerC: Upcoming hill.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually diamond-shaped with black markings on a yellow background. They alert drivers to upcoming hazards. This sign indicates that drivers are approaching a steep hill and should prepare to adjust their speeds to continue to drive safely.

questions.question: A vehicle using emergency signals is approaching from the opposite direction on a two-lane street. You should:
questions.answerA: Stop as quickly as you can.
questions.answerB: Slow down, move as far to the right as possible, and stop.
questions.answerC: Disregard the emergency vehicle because it is going in the opposite direction.
questions.explanation: If you hear the siren or see the flashing lights of an emergency vehicle, you must slow down, provide a clear path for the vehicle, and stop. Don't try to outdrive the emergency vehicle. This law applies on any two-lane street, even if the emergency vehicle is approaching from the opposite direction.

questions.question: What might happen when alcohol is combined with another drug?
questions.answerA: The effects of the alcohol and the drug may both be increased.
questions.answerB: Nothing will happen.
questions.answerC: The effects of the alcohol and the drug may both be reduced.
questions.answerD: The effects of only the alcohol may be reduced.
questions.explanation: Consuming both alcohol and another drug may enhance the effects of both. For example, taking one drink when you are also using a cold remedy could affect you as if you have had several drinks.

questions.question: At a light rail intersection, always:
questions.answerA: Look both ways before crossing tracks.
questions.answerB: Pay attention and obey all traffic signals.
questions.answerC: Share the road with pedestrians and bicyclists.
questions.explanation: You should never drive around lowered crossing gates. Always look both ways before turning across train tracks and always obey signs and traffic signals. Trains share the road with motor vehicles and bicyclists.

questions.question: Round signs indicate:
questions.answerA: No passing zones.
questions.answerB: School zones.
questions.answerC: Upcoming railroad crossings.
questions.explanation: Round signs warn drivers of an upcoming railroad crossing area. Drivers should use extra caution when approaching a railroad crossing.

questions.question: When driving in fog:
questions.answerA: Use your parking lights.
questions.answerB: Use your low beams.
questions.answerC: Use your high beams.
questions.answerD: It makes no difference which lights you use.
questions.explanation: You should use low beam headlights when driving in fog, rain, or snow.

questions.question: You are driving on the roadway and there is an emergency vehicle using its siren and flashing lights directly behind you. You are in heavy traffic and cannot get out of its way. You should:
questions.answerA: Stop where you are.
questions.answerB: Blow your horn.
questions.answerC: Force your way into traffic in the adjoining lane.
questions.answerD: Keep moving slowly until you can get out of its way.
questions.explanation: If an emergency vehicle is directly behind your vehicle while you are in heavy traffic, continue moving slowly until you can get out of its way. When possible, you must clear a path for the emergency vehicle.

questions.question: Having a few drinks before driving home after work:
questions.answerA: Is good because you will miss rush-hour traffic.
questions.answerB: Is good because the drinks will help release the day’s tension and make you a safer driver.
questions.answerC: Should be avoided because the drinks may make you a dangerous driver.
questions.explanation: Driving a motor vehicle while under the influence of alcohol is prohibited in Hawaii. Alcohol slows normal reflexes, interferes with judgment, reduces alertness, and impairs vision. If you feel stimulated after drinking, it is simply because your inhibitions are lowered, causing a loss of caution and self-control. It is safest to refrain from driving when you have consumed any quantity of alcohol.

questions.question: Emergency vehicles:
questions.answerA: Have the right-of-way when using sirens, horns, and/or flashing lights.
questions.answerB: May use a loudspeaker to give instructions.
questions.answerC: May follow each other.
questions.explanation: You must yield the right-of-way to police cars, fire engines, ambulances, or any other emergency vehicles using a siren or air horn and a red or blue flashing light. Follow any instructions given over the emergency vehicles' loudspeakers. Emergency vehicles often follow each other so you should proceed only when you are certain the way is clear.

questions.question: If you change your address from that shown on your vehicle's registration certificate, you:
questions.answerA: Must notify the County Department of Finance when renewing your license.
questions.answerB: Must notify the County Department of Finance within 30 days of the change.
questions.answerC: Must notify the County Department of Finance only when selling or trading your car.
questions.answerD: Do not have to do anything.
questions.explanation: Whenever you change your address, you must provide the county examiner of drivers with your new address, your name, and driver license number. This must be done in writing and within 30 days of the change. A change of name requires you to appear in person at the appropriate office within 30 days with proof of the change.

questions.question: While driving on a two-lane road without bicycle lanes, you encounter a bicyclist traveling in the same direction. What is the safest way to pass the bicyclist?
questions.answerA: Slow down and wait until there is no traffic approaching, then pass the bicyclist while leaving him or her sufficient space.
questions.answerB: Continue driving straight. It is the bicyclist’s responsibility to get out of your way.
questions.answerC: Do not pass the bicyclist until you come to a traffic signal or stop sign.
questions.answerD: Honk at the bicyclist to let him or her know you are about to pass.
questions.explanation: You should pass a bicyclist the same way you would pass any other vehicle, but not so fast or close to them that you throw debris in their face or blow them around with the draft of air from your vehicle. Allow at least 3 feet of space between your side mirror and the bicyclist, or at least 5 feet on higher speed roads or when there is a group of bicyclists. Honking unnecessarily may startle riders and make them more likely to crash.

questions.question: When the road is marked with a solid yellow line and a broken yellow line, with the broken line next to your lane, you may pass:
questions.answerA: Only in an emergency.
questions.answerB: If you are on an expressway.
questions.answerC: If traffic is clear.
questions.explanation: When there is a solid yellow line and a broken yellow line in the center of the road and the broken line is next to your lane, you may cross the lines to pass if there is no oncoming traffic.

questions.question: You are stopped in a line of vehicles waiting at a stop sign. If there is no cross traffic after the vehicles ahead have passed through the intersection, you:
questions.answerA: May proceed through the intersection without stopping again.
questions.answerB: Must stop again at the stop sign or stop line before proceeding.
questions.answerC: May slowly roll past the stop sign.
questions.answerD: May follow the vehicle directly ahead of you without stopping.
questions.explanation: You must always bring your vehicle to a complete stop and yield to approaching traffic before proceeding past a stop sign. Don't feel pressured by surrounding traffic to avoid making a complete stop.

questions.question: You are driving when it begins to rain. You should:
questions.answerA: Drive faster than surrounding traffic.
questions.answerB: Drive at the maximum posted speed limit.
questions.answerC: Slow down.
questions.answerD: Drive closely behind the vehicle in front of you.
questions.explanation: When heavy rain reduces visibility, reduce your speed. Turn on your headlights so other drivers can see your vehicle. If the rain is so heavy that you are unable to see clearly, drive onto the shoulder and stop until the rain lets up.

questions.question: Two solid yellow lines on the pavement mean:
questions.answerA: Passing is allowed for drivers from both directions.
questions.answerB: Passing is not allowed.
questions.answerC: Passing is allowed if you are at the top a hill.
questions.answerD: Passing is allowed during daylight only.
questions.explanation: Yellow lines tell you that the traffic on the other side of the lines is moving in the opposite direction. You should never cross two solid yellow lines to pass from either direction.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: The left lane is reserved for vehicles with a specific number of occupants.
questions.answerB: Specific turning movements are allowed from specific lanes.
questions.answerC: Do not enter.
questions.answerD: Drivers in both lanes are responsible for merging smoothly.
questions.explanation: This sign marks a high occupancy vehicle (HOV) lane. HOV lanes are reserved for use by buses and vehicles with a driver and one or more passengers, as indicated on the sign.

questions.question: Seat belts are most effective when they are worn by:
questions.answerA: The person driving the car.
questions.answerB: Passengers when they are on a long drive.
questions.answerC: All occupants of a car being driven on an expressway.
questions.answerD: All occupants of a car every time the car is driven.
questions.explanation: When you drive, make sure each person in your vehicle wears a seat belt. In the event of a crash, a person without a seat belt becomes a flying object and a danger to each person in the vehicle.

questions.question: Your ability to stop is affected by:
questions.answerA: Signal lights.
questions.answerB: Other cars on the road.
questions.answerC: The time of day.
questions.explanation: Your ability to stop is greatly affected by the condition of the road. You need to reduce your speed when road conditions are poor in order to maintain control of your vehicle. You will be at risk if you are driving too quickly on roads that are slippery and you need to stop.

questions.question: What should you be most concerned about when you see this sign?
questions.answerA: Driving with your headlights out of alignment because one side of your car is higher than the other.
questions.answerB: Damaging a tire from drifting onto the shoulder.
questions.answerC: Hydroplaning, if the shoulder has water on it.
questions.answerD: Losing control of the vehicle if you drift onto the shoulder.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that the shoulder is lower than the road in the area ahead. If you drift off of the roadway and one wheel drops onto a low shoulder, do not slam on the brakes or steer sharply to try to get back onto the roadway. This could easily cause you to lose control of your vehicle.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Wildlife crossing.
questions.answerB: School crossing or school zone.
questions.answerC: Pedestrian crossing.
questions.explanation: Five-sided signs indicate there is a school nearby and drivers should be alert to children and pedestrians in or near the road. This sign can indicate either a school crossing or a school zone.

questions.question: Downward-facing triangular signs:
questions.answerA: Indicate school zones.
questions.answerB: Tell drivers to yield.
questions.answerC: Indicate construction zones.
questions.explanation: Downward-facing triangular signs usually indicate that drivers should yield. Once the road is clear of traffic or pedestrians and it is safe to do so, drivers may proceed.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: A steep grade is ahead.
questions.answerB: You must turn left ahead.
questions.answerC: Do not enter.
questions.explanation: This signs warns that a four-way intersection is ahead.

questions.question: When sharing the road with a truck, it is important to remember that trucks generally:
questions.answerA: Require longer distances to stop than smaller vehicles do.
questions.answerB: Require less time to pass on a downgrade than smaller vehicles do.
questions.answerC: Require a smaller turning radius than smaller vehicles do.
questions.answerD: Require less time to pass on an incline than smaller vehicles do.
questions.explanation: Because of their size, trucks need longer distances to stop than smaller vehicles do.

questions.question: When you need to change lanes, it is important to:
questions.answerA: Signal your intentions ahead of the lane change.
questions.answerB: Check your blind spot.
questions.answerC: Make sure the lane is clear before entering.
questions.explanation: Always signal for an appropriate amount of time before making a lane change or exiting a freeway. Before you make any move to the right or left, quickly turn your head and look over your shoulder to see if your blind spot is clear.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Stop sign ahead.
questions.answerB: Lane closed ahead.
questions.answerC: Railroad crossing ahead.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually diamond-shaped with black markings on a yellow background. They alert drivers to upcoming hazards. This warning sign indicates that a traffic signal is ahead and drivers should prepare to react to a yellow or red light.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Steep downgrade.
questions.answerB: Crossroad ahead.
questions.answerC: No right turn.
questions.explanation: Warning signs prepare drivers for upcoming road conditions and hazards and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers about an upcoming steep hill. They should adjust their speed accordingly to avoid brake damage or collision.

questions.question: A person who drives much slower than the speed limit:
questions.answerA: Is a very safe driver.
questions.answerB: Always has the right-of-way.
questions.answerC: Should not let following cars pass.
questions.answerD: May create a dangerous driving environment.
questions.explanation: Driving more slowly than the flow of traffic can be hazardous. If you are on a two-lane, two-way road and driving so slowly that traffic is backing up behind you, you are required to pull off the road and let the other vehicles pass. Only drive significantly under the speed limit when conditions require it.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: Increase your speed.
questions.answerB: Railroad crossing ahead.
questions.answerC: Intersection ahead.
questions.explanation: This sign means that you are approaching an upcoming intersection. Watch carefully for cross traffic.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Slippery when wet.
questions.answerB: Watch for drunk drivers.
questions.answerC: Dangerous curve ahead.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually diamond-shaped with black markings on a yellow background. They alert drivers to upcoming hazards. This sign warns drivers to be extra careful when the pavement is wet because the road may become slippery, making vehicles more difficult to control.

questions.question: Which of the following statements is true?
questions.answerA: A sudden change in weather calls for a change in driving.
questions.answerB: You should slow down when driving in rain and fog.
questions.answerC: Be particularly aware of vehicles coming up behind you in inclement weather.
questions.explanation: If the weather changes suddenly, you will need to adjust your driving to adapt. Always slow down when driving in rainy or foggy conditions. Be especially aware of vehicles behind you that may be going too fast for conditions.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: Your current roadway ends ahead.
questions.answerB: You must bear either right or left.
questions.answerC: A four-way intersection is ahead.
questions.answerD: A road joins from the right.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that there is a Y intersection ahead. You must bear either to the right or to the left.

questions.question: A driver entering interstate traffic from an entrance or acceleration ramp:
questions.answerA: Should yield to drivers already on the interstate.
questions.answerB: Has the right-of-way.
questions.answerC: May force their way into traffic.
questions.answerD: Can assume that other drivers will change lanes to make room.
questions.explanation: If you are on an entrance or acceleration ramp and are entering interstate traffic, you should yield to drivers already on the interstate highway. Merge safely into traffic when you are able to do so.

questions.question: When parking uphill on a hill or incline with a curb:
questions.answerA: Turn your front wheels sharply toward the curb.
questions.answerB: Turn your front wheels slightly to the right.
questions.answerC: Turn your front wheels sharply away from the curb.
questions.explanation: To keep your vehicle from rolling into traffic when parked facing uphill, turn your front wheels sharply away from the curb. If you are parking uphill on a street that has no curb, turn the wheels sharply toward the edge of the road.

questions.question: To turn left from multilane, one-way streets and highways, you should start from:
questions.answerA: The middle of the intersection.
questions.answerB: The right lane.
questions.answerC: The left lane.
questions.explanation: To turn left from multilane streets and highways, start from the left lane.

questions.question: To drive safely at night, you should:
questions.answerA: Increase your following distance.
questions.answerB: Not drive if you are tired.
questions.answerC: Make sure your headlights are working properly.
questions.explanation: At night, visibility is reduced. Take steps to make driving in the dark more safe for you and the other drivers on the road.

questions.question: Bicyclists must refrain from:
questions.answerA: Carrying passengers, unless the bicycle is equipped to do so.
questions.answerB: Riding on the sidewalk in every location.
questions.answerC: Riding at night.
questions.answerD: Riding in the roadway in a business district.
questions.explanation: Bicyclists are not allowed to ride on the sidewalk in business districts. In other areas, bicyclists may ride on sidewalks as long as they stay at speeds of 10 mph or slower and always yield the right-of-way to pedestrians. Bicyclists may ride at night if they have a headlight and rear reflector. Bicyclists should never transport passengers, unless the bicycle is equipped to do so.

questions.question: If you are driving so slowly that traffic is backing up behind you, you should:
questions.answerA: Decrease your speed.
questions.answerB: Pull off the right side of the road and let traffic pass.
questions.answerC: Not let the other cars pass your vehicle.
questions.explanation: Driving more slowly than the flow of traffic can be hazardous. If you are on a two-lane, two-way road and driving so slowly that traffic is backing up behind you, you are required to pull off the road and let the other vehicles pass. Only drive significantly under the speed limit when conditions require it.

questions.question: Information you need in order to drive safely is gained primarily by:
questions.answerA: Seeing.
questions.answerB: Talking to yourself.
questions.answerC: Following other traffic.
questions.explanation: Almost all of the information you need in order to safely drive is obtained by seeing. You should have a constant awareness of conditions in your vehicle's vicinity. Special attention should be devoted to conditions a considerable distance ahead of your vehicle.

questions.question: After stopping for a school bus that is unloading children:
questions.answerA: Do not proceed until the children wave to you.
questions.answerB: Watch for children walking along the side of the road.
questions.answerC: Accelerate quickly.
questions.explanation: After stopping for a school bus that has its stop arm extended and its lights flashing, watch for children walking along the side of the road. You should always drive with caution when driving near children.

questions.question: Lanes of traffic moving in opposite directions are divided by ____ lines.
questions.answerA: White
questions.answerB: Red
questions.answerC: Black
questions.explanation: Yellow lines are used to divide traffic moving in opposite directions.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: Sharp right turn.
questions.answerB: A road joins from the right.
questions.answerC: The road ahead turns sharply right, then sharply left.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that the road ahead turns sharply to the right and then sharply to the left.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: No right turn.
questions.answerB: Curve.
questions.answerC: Turn right or left.
questions.answerD: Traffic flows only in the direction of the arrow.
questions.explanation: This one-way sign indicates that traffic flows only in the direction of the arrow.

questions.question: When driving in fog, you should use your:
questions.answerA: Low beam headlights.
questions.answerB: High beam headlights.
questions.answerC: Parking lights.
questions.explanation: If you must drive in foggy conditions, you should use your low beam headlights, as well as your fog lights, if your vehicle has them. High beams direct their light upwards, where it can bounce off the fog and into your eyes, reducing visibility even more.

questions.question: Your vehicle strikes an unattended parked vehicle and you cannot locate the vehicle’s owner. You:
questions.answerA: Have done as much as you can.
questions.answerB: Must stay until the police arrive.
questions.answerC: Must leave a written notice containing your name, your address, and the circumstances of the accident.
questions.explanation: Upon striking an unattended vehicle, stop and try to locate the owner. If you cannot find the owner, leave a written notice containing your name, your address, and the circumstances of the accident.

questions.question: If you see this sign, you:
questions.answerA: Should maintain your vehicle’s speed until you enter the reduced speed zone.
questions.answerB: Should begin to reduce your vehicle’s speed.
questions.answerC: Should not slow down because traffic will start to back up.
questions.answerD: May reduce your speed, if you choose to do so.
questions.explanation: "Reduced speed ahead" signs inform drivers that they should begin to reduce the speed of their vehicles. The new speed limit will begin at the next speed limit sign.

questions.question: As a motorist, you should:
questions.answerA: Respect the rights and privileges of bicyclists.
questions.answerB: Allow a bicyclist twice as much room as you think they need.
questions.answerC: Give a bicyclist the right-of-way when you crossing a bike lane.
questions.explanation: Bicycles are legally considered vehicles with the same rights and responsibilities as other vehicles. Look for and yield to bicyclists when crossing bike lanes. When driving a motor vehicle, give bicyclists plenty of space.

questions.question: When you see this black and yellow sign, it means:
questions.answerA: The road to the right is for one-way traffic only.
questions.answerB: That due to upcoming roadwork, there is a detour to the right.
questions.answerC: Slow down because the road ahead changes direction at an extreme angle.
questions.answerD: There is a crossroad to your right.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that the road ahead changes direction at an extreme angle (in this case, to the right). Before you reach such an extreme curve, you should slow down as much as you would when making a turn at an intersection.

questions.question: You experience an incident at work that has left you feeling angry. When you get to your car, you should:
questions.answerA: Play the radio loudly so you won’t think about it.
questions.answerB: Drive fast on the interstate to let off steam.
questions.answerC: Take a few minutes to cool off before you begin your drive home.
questions.answerD: Stop at your favorite bar and have a few drinks before driving home.
questions.explanation: Persons who are upset, angry, or otherwise distracted by their emotions should take time to cool off before driving a car. Taking out frustrations or anger while driving is exercising very poor judgment and is very dangerous to both the driver and others on the road.

questions.question: When driving past a vehicle that has just stopped in a parked position on the side of the road, you should:
questions.answerA: Assume that the driver will open the car door as you approach.
questions.answerB: Speed up.
questions.answerC: Slam on your brakes.
questions.answerD: Assume that the driver will wait for you to pass before opening the door.
questions.explanation: When passing a vehicle that has just parked parallel to the road, you should assume the driver will open the door as you approach. Use extra caution when driving near parked vehicles.

questions.question: If involved in an accident, a driver should:
questions.answerA: Stop their vehicle at or near the scene.
questions.answerB: Not stand or walk in traffic lanes.
questions.answerC: Turn off the ignitions of wrecked vehicles.
questions.explanation: If you are involved in an accident, you must stop at or near the scene. Move your vehicle out of the way of traffic, if possible. Do not stand or walk in traffic lanes as you could be struck by another vehicle. Turn off the ignitions of wrecked vehicles.

questions.question: When passing a motorcycle, you must:
questions.answerA: Allow the motorcyclist the right half of a traffic lane.
questions.answerB: Allow the motorcyclist the entire width of a traffic lane.
questions.answerC: Begin moving past the motorcycle before your vehicle is entirely in the passing lane.
questions.explanation: Give motorcyclists, bicyclists, and pedestrians plenty of space. Use extra caution when making turns or changing lanes near one of these road users. A motorcyclist is entitled to the entire width of a traffic lane.

questions.question: If you are driving on the interstate and pass your exit, you should:
questions.answerA: Quickly cut across traffic to make your turn.
questions.answerB: Make a U-turn to go back to the exit.
questions.answerC: Continue driving and use the next exit.
questions.answerD: Put your vehicle in reverse to go back to the exit.
questions.explanation: Don’t make a last-minute turn into an exit. If you pass your exit, you must go to the next one.

questions.question: To prevent hydroplaning, you should:
questions.answerA: Ensure that your tires have good tread depth.
questions.answerB: Ensure that your tires are properly inflated.
questions.answerC: Reduce your speed when driving in the rain.
questions.explanation: To prevent hydroplaning, you should ensure that the tires on your vehicle have good tread depth and are inflated to the proper pressure. Reduce the speed of your vehicle when driving in the rain. Hydroplaning occurs most frequently at higher speeds.

questions.question: This sign is used to warn drivers about:
questions.answerA: Upcoming intersections.
questions.answerB: Road construction.
questions.answerC: An upcoming curve in the road.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that the road ahead curves to the right.

questions.question: You may drink alcoholic beverages in a vehicle on a public highway:
questions.answerA: As long as you aren't driving.
questions.answerB: If you are riding in the back seat.
questions.answerC: If you are riding in the back of a pick-up truck.
questions.explanation: It is against the law to consume or possess any alcoholic beverage while on a public road or sidewalk. Additionally, storing an open alcoholic beverage container in an area of a motor vehicle normally occupied by the driver or passenger is prohibited on any public road.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Traffic signal.
questions.answerB: Fire station.
questions.answerC: T intersection.
questions.explanation: Warning signs prepare drivers for upcoming road conditions and hazards and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign alerts drivers to an upcoming traffic signal. They should be prepared to respond to a yellow light, red light, and/or cross traffic.

questions.question: At an intersection with a yield sign, you should:
questions.answerA: Always stop before entering the intersection.
questions.answerB: Yield just to the traffic on the right.
questions.answerC: Yield just to the traffic on the left.
questions.answerD: Slow down and yield the right-of-way to other traffic.
questions.explanation: A yield sign means that you must slow down and yield the right-of-way to traffic in the intersection or roadway you are entering.

questions.question: While driving, your wheels slip off the edge of the road. You should:
questions.answerA: Jerk the steering wheel to force the vehicle back onto the pavement.
questions.answerB: Speed up and steer back onto the pavement gradually.
questions.answerC: Slam on your brakes and stop.
questions.answerD: Slow down by gently using the brakes. Turn the steering wheel to return to the pavement at a safe speed.
questions.explanation: If your vehicle begins to leave the road, continue to drive with the wheels off the pavement and reduce your speed by gently applying the brakes. When at a safe speed, turn the steering wheel to return to the pavement. Do not attempt to force your vehicle back onto the pavement by sharply turning the steering wheel.

questions.question: You are waiting in the intersection to complete a left turn. You should:
questions.answerA: Signal and keep your wheels turned to the left.
questions.answerB: Signal and keep your wheels straight.
questions.answerC: Flash your headlights so drivers will let you through.
questions.answerD: Drive around the rear of a car if it blocks you.
questions.explanation: You must always signal before turning or changing lanes. You should keep your wheels straight while waiting to make a left turn. If another vehicle hits you from behind, this ensures that you will not be pushed into oncoming traffic.

questions.question: If you are driving near a motorcycle, you must:
questions.answerA: Allow the motorcycle to use a complete lane.
questions.answerB: Drive on the shoulder beside the motorcycle.
questions.answerC: Allow the motorcycle to use only half of a lane.
questions.answerD: Pass using the same lane as the motorcycle.
