After checking your mirrors, check your blind spot by turning your head and looking over your shoulder in the direction of your move. Signal your intention at least 100 feet before you start the lane change. Don't move into a space between vehicles if doing so would interfere with their safe following distances.

questions.question: Drive below the posted speed limit when:
questions.answerA: Anything makes conditions less than perfect.
questions.answerB: You see a police car.
questions.answerC: Entering a highway where there are other cars.
questions.answerD: You are on a four-lane road.
questions.explanation: When the road is wet or slippery, when you cannot see well, or when anything else makes conditions less than perfect, drive below the posted speed limit. Even if you are driving within the posted speed limit, you can still be ticketed for driving too fast for conditions.

questions.question: If you are stopped by a police officer, you should:
questions.answerA: Unbuckle your seat belt and lower your window.
questions.answerB: Get your paperwork ready before the officer reaches your car.
questions.answerC: Stay in your vehicle with your hands on the steering wheel and wait for the officer to approach you.
questions.answerD: Get out of your car and walk toward the patrol car.
questions.explanation: If you are stopped by the police, keep your hands on the wheel and ask any passengers to keep their hands in view as well. You should remain in the vehicle unless the police officer asks you to get out. Wait until the officer asks you to retrieve your driver license, registration, and insurance cards.

questions.question: When a stop is required at an intersection and no markings appear to indicate a stop line or crosswalk, a driver:
questions.answerA: Is not required to stop.
questions.answerB: Is required to slow down to make sure crossing traffic is clear.
questions.answerC: Should stop only at a place where they can see at least 200 feet on either side, even if they have to enter the intersecting roadway.
questions.answerD: Should stop where they have a clear view of approaching traffic before they enter the intersecting roadway.
questions.explanation: If there is no stop line or crosswalk, you should stop at the point nearest to the intersecting roadway where you can get a view of approaching traffic. You should not enter the intersecting roadway to gain a better view.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: Cars in right lane must slow down.
questions.answerB: No left turn.
questions.answerC: Merge.
questions.answerD: Pass only in the right lane.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates a merge ahead. It warns that two lanes of traffic moving in the same direction are about to become one.

questions.question: You may drive across a dashed white line:
questions.answerA: At any time.
questions.answerB: Only during daylight hours.
questions.answerC: When it is safe to change lanes.
questions.explanation: Traffic lanes moving in the same direction are separated by broken white lines. You may cross over dashed lines to pass, if it is safe to do so.

questions.question: This sign is used to warn drivers:
questions.answerA: That the right lane ends and traffic should merge left.
questions.answerB: That the road curves ahead.
questions.answerC: About upcoming intersections.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that the right lane on a multilane roadway ends ahead. Traffic in the right lane must merge left.

questions.question: Don’t follow other cars too closely because:
questions.answerA: You may not see the road between the cars.
questions.answerB: You may not have time to stop if the vehicle in front of you slows or stops suddenly.
questions.answerC: You may not see the vehicle's turn signals.
questions.answerD: You may not see the other vehicle’s brake lights.
questions.explanation: If you follow too closely and the vehicle in front of you slows or stops suddenly, you may not have enough time to avoid a collision.

questions.question: You want to back out of your driveway. You see children playing nearby. Before you start to move your car, you should:
questions.answerA: Rev your engine to warn the children that you are moving.
questions.answerB: Sound your horn so the children will hear you.
questions.answerC: Walk to the back of the car to be sure the way is clear.
questions.answerD: Tell the children to stay away from the driveway.
questions.explanation: When you back up a vehicle, look through your back window for pedestrians and other obstacles. Do not rely only on your mirrors, especially when children are near. Before you back into or out of a driveway, get out of the vehicle and check behind your vehicle.

questions.question: You are driving on the roadway and hear a siren behind you. You should:
questions.answerA: Stop where you are.
questions.answerB: Pull over to the right and stop.
questions.answerC: Speed up to get out of the way.
questions.explanation: When you hear the siren or see the flashing lights of an emergency vehicle coming from behind your vehicle, you must create a clear path for the emergency vehicle and stop. Reduce your speed and safely pull over to the side of the road. If the emergency vehicle is directly behind your vehicle when you are in heavy traffic, keep moving slowly until you can get out of its way.

questions.question: The risk of hydroplaning can can be reduced by driving:
questions.answerA: Through shallow water.
questions.answerB: More quickly.
questions.answerC: More slowly.
questions.explanation: Because hydroplaning is caused by driving too quickly in wet conditions, the risk of it happening can be reduced by driving more slowly.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Pedestrians only.
questions.answerB: Intersection ahead.
questions.answerC: Hiking trails ahead.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that a school crossing is ahead.

questions.question: When driving in traffic, it is safest to:
questions.answerA: Fluctuate your speed to keep alert.
questions.answerB: Drive faster than the flow of traffic.
questions.answerC: Drive slower than the flow of traffic.
questions.answerD: Drive with the flow of traffic.
questions.explanation: Crashes often happen when some drivers go faster or slower than other vehicles on the road. Always try to drive with the flow of traffic, within the posted speed limit.

questions.question: Information you need in order to drive safely is gained primarily by:
questions.answerA: Seeing.
questions.answerB: Talking to yourself.
questions.answerC: Following other traffic.
questions.explanation: Almost all of the information you need in order to safely drive is obtained by seeing. You should have a constant awareness of conditions in your vehicle's vicinity. Special attention should be devoted to conditions a considerable distance ahead of your vehicle.

questions.question: You may pass another vehicle:
questions.answerA: In a curve or on a hill because the chance is small that another vehicle is coming.
questions.answerB: By using the shoulder of the highway.
questions.answerC: If your lane is next to a solid yellow line and the passing lane is clear ahead.
questions.explanation: You may not pass another vehicle on a hill or in a curve because you cannot see oncoming traffic and may cause a collision. Never pass another vehicle by driving onto the shoulder of a highway. Passing another vehicle by driving over a solid yellow line is prohibited.

questions.question: A red and white triangular sign at an intersection means:
questions.answerA: Slow down if an emergency vehicle is approaching.
questions.answerB: Look both ways as you cross the intersection.
questions.answerC: Always come to a full stop at the intersection.
questions.answerD: Slow down and be prepared to stop if necessary.
questions.explanation: A triangular red and white yield sign means that you must decrease speed as you approach an intersection and yield the right-of-way to any vehicles or pedestrians in the intersection. You must be prepared to stop if conditions require it.

questions.question: A single broken white line down the center of a two-lane road indicates:
questions.answerA: Lanes are moving in opposite directions and drivers are not permitted to pass.
questions.answerB: Lanes are moving in opposite directions and drivers are permitted to pass when it is safe to do so.
questions.answerC: Lanes are moving in the same direction and drivers are not permitted to pass.
questions.answerD: Lanes are moving in the same direction and drivers are permitted to pass when it is safe to do so.
questions.explanation: White lines are used to separate traffic moving in the same direction. Dashed lines indicate that drivers directly next to the line are permitted to pass when it is safe to do so.

questions.question: Traffic signals sometimes display arrows to control turns from specific lanes. A solid yellow arrow:
questions.answerA: Is never used as a traffic signal.
questions.answerB: Has the same meaning as a circular yellow traffic light.
questions.answerC: Means that drivers may turn in the direction indicated by the arrow.
questions.answerD: Tells drivers that a green arrow is about to be shown.
questions.explanation: A solid yellow arrow has the same meaning as a yellow traffic light. When approaching a solid yellow arrow, you must reduce your speed and prepare for a red light.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Curves ahead.
questions.answerB: Divided highway starts.
questions.answerC: Divided highway ends.
questions.explanation: This sign warns drivers that the divided highway ends ahead.

questions.question: Railroad crossings should always be considered:
questions.answerA: Safe to cross, as it is unlikely that a train will be coming.
questions.answerB: Dangerous.
questions.answerC: Safe locations to park a car.
questions.answerD: A place where it is required to stop
questions.explanation: Railroad crossings are always dangerous. Drivers should always look and listen for trains approaching from either direction on all railroad tracks. Always follow the directions indicated by signs, signals, and flaggers. Never proceed past a railroad crossing until you are certain it is safe to do so.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: No right turn.
questions.answerB: You must turn right.
questions.answerC: Watch for traffic on your right.
questions.answerD: Don’t park on the right side of the street.
questions.explanation: A sign with a red circle and slash over a symbol indicates that the action represented by the symbol (in this example, a right turn) is not allowed.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Low clearance.
questions.answerB: Fines double in a work zone.
questions.answerC: No left turn.
questions.explanation: Warning signs prepare drivers for upcoming road conditions and hazards and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign tells drivers that they are approaching an area with low clearance.

questions.question: Which is not a factor in determining the distance that it takes to stop your vehicle?
questions.answerA: Steering ability
questions.answerB: Braking distance
questions.answerC: Reaction distance
questions.explanation: The distance required to stop your vehicle depends on perception time, reaction distance, and braking distance. This changes with speed and road conditions.

questions.question: You are involved in an accident. You should:
questions.answerA: Stop immediately.
questions.answerB: Help the injured.
questions.answerC: Call the police.
questions.explanation: If involved in an accident, you should stop your vehicle immediately. If possible, move the vehicle out of the way of traffic. Call the nearest police agency and ask for an ambulance, if necessary. Do not move the injured unnecessarily, but attempt to stop severe bleeding with direct pressure. Wait for emergency vehicles to arrive.

questions.question: Your brake lights tell other drivers that you:
questions.answerA: Are making a turn.
questions.answerB: Have your emergency brake on.
questions.answerC: Are changing lanes.
questions.explanation: Your vehicle's brake lights indicate to other drivers that you are slowing down or stopping. Your brake lights should always be in working order when you are driving on any roadway.

questions.question: To help relieve fatigue on a long trip, it is a good idea to:
questions.answerA: Stop and rest every two hours.
questions.answerB: Do arm exercises every hour.
questions.answerC: Drive with one eye open at a time.
questions.answerD: Change feet on the gas pedal.
questions.explanation: To avoid becoming fatigued while taking a long trip, stop every two hours for a short break. If you become drowsy, pull off the road and park in a safe place to take a nap, or find a room to stay for the night.

questions.question: Pennant-shaped signs indicate:
questions.answerA: School zones.
questions.answerB: No passing zones.
questions.answerC: Speed limits.
questions.explanation: Pennant-shaped signs usually indicate no passing zones. Text will also be on the sign to confirm that it is a no passing zone.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: T intersection.
questions.answerB: Lane shifting.
questions.answerC: Side road.
questions.explanation: Warning signs prepare drivers for upcoming road conditions and hazards and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers that they are approaching a T intersection and should prepare to turn either right or left.

questions.question: What are the colors of warning signs indicating upcoming hazards?
questions.answerA: Black letters or symbols on a white background
questions.answerB: Black letters or symbols on a yellow background
questions.answerC: White letters or symbols on a blue background
questions.answerD: White letters or symbols on a green background
questions.explanation: Warning signs that indicate approaching hazards are usually yellow with black lettering or symbols. Warning signs in work zones are orange with black lettering or symbols.

questions.question: What does alcohol do to your driving skills and judgement?
questions.answerA: It helps driving skills but harms your judgement.
questions.answerB: It harms both driving skills and judgement.
questions.answerC: It has no effect on either driving skills or judgement.
questions.answerD: It has no effect on judgement but it harms driving skills.
questions.explanation: Alcohol negatively affects many skills needed for safe driving, including your reaction time and ability to see clearly. It can also harm your judgment of speed and distance, lower your inhibitions, and make you more prone to taking chances.

questions.question: Highway markings:
questions.answerA: Are usually not important.
questions.answerB: Are only found in construction zones.
questions.answerC: Provide information for drivers.
questions.answerD: Are usually red and blue in color.
questions.explanation: Highway markings provide information for drivers. Markings help drivers correctly position their vehicles on roadways, inform drivers of safe passing zones, and warn drivers about upcoming conditions.

questions.question: Driving at night requires increased caution because:
questions.answerA: Traffic moves faster at night.
questions.answerB: There is a larger volume of traffic at night.
questions.answerC: Drivers cannot see as well at night.
questions.answerD: Accidents occur more frequently at night.
questions.explanation: Because it is dark, drivers cannot see as well at night as they can during the day. From one half hour after sunset until one half hour before sunrise, or at any other time when persons or vehicles are not visible for 500 feet, drivers must use their headlights.

questions.question: When towing a trailer, you must make sure that:
questions.answerA: The trailer has a safety chain securely attached to the trailer hitch.
questions.answerB: The trailer has a safety chain securely attached to the vehicle’s bumper.
questions.answerC: The trailer has a safety chain securely attached to the frame of the towing vehicle.
questions.answerD: The trailer hitch is equipped with a fail-safe latch.
questions.explanation: Your trailer must be equipped with safety chains. Safety chains must be attached to the frame of the towing vehicle and the trailer. They should not be connected to a part of the trailer hitch.

questions.question: As a pedestrian, you should:
questions.answerA: Look for turning vehicles before crossing a street.
questions.answerB: Never run alongside or across a street.
questions.answerC: Walk on the left side of the street, facing traffic.
questions.explanation: As a pedestrian, do not run alongside or across a street. Walk on the left side of the street, facing oncoming traffic. Always look for turning vehicles before crossing a street.

questions.question: When driving past a vehicle that has just stopped in a parked position on the side of the road, you should:
questions.answerA: Assume that the driver will open the car door as you approach.
questions.answerB: Speed up.
questions.answerC: Slam on your brakes.
questions.answerD: Assume that the driver will wait for you to pass before opening the door.
questions.explanation: When passing a vehicle that has just parked parallel to the road, you should assume the driver will open the door as you approach. Use extra caution when driving near parked vehicles.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Divided highway ends.
questions.answerB: One-way traffic ahead.
questions.answerC: Two-way traffic ahead.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that you must keep to the right of the upcoming divider.

questions.question: Fog can greatly reduce the visibility of other vehicles, pedestrians, and traffic signals. When driving in fog, you should:
questions.answerA: Drive cautiously and reduce your speed.
questions.answerB: Not use your high beam headlights.
questions.answerC: Use low beam headlights to better illuminate the road and objects.
questions.explanation: Fog can greatly reduce your ability to see other vehicles, pedestrians, and traffic signals. When driving in fog, drive cautiously and at reduced speeds. Do not use high beam headlights. Low beams better illuminate the road and objects ahead in foggy conditions.

questions.question: A telltale sign of a drunk driver is:
questions.answerA: They are weaving between lanes.
questions.answerB: They are driving more slowly than the normal traffic flow.
questions.answerC: They are making quick and sudden stops.
questions.explanation: Telltale signs of drunk driving include speeding, weaving, driving more slowly than the normal traffic flow, making jerking motions, and making quick and sudden stops.

questions.question: You must not drive your vehicle at a speed greater than:
questions.answerA: The maximum speed limit.
questions.answerB: A speed that is faster than is reasonable and prudent.
questions.answerC: A speed that is safe for existing conditions.
questions.explanation: You must not drive at a speed that is faster than is reasonable and prudent. You must drive at a speed that is appropriate for the area where you are driving, the type and condition of surrounding traffic, the presence of pedestrians, the weather, the quality of the road, and light conditions. You must drive within legal speed limits.

questions.question: Which of the following is a safe way to drive through a curve?
questions.answerA: Slow down as you enter, speed up as you exit.
questions.answerB: Maintain a constant speed throughout the curve.
questions.answerC: Speed up as you enter, slow down as you exit.
questions.answerD: Stay near the right edge of your lane.
questions.explanation: You should slow down as you enter a curve and increase your speed gradually as you exit. Increasing your speed as you enter a curve will make it more difficult to control your vehicle.

questions.question: What should you do when you see this sign?
questions.answerA: Look for a train station ahead.
questions.answerB: Signal before going any further.
questions.answerC: Slow down and yield for trains.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that there is a railroad crossing on the road ahead. You should always slow down when approaching a railroad crossing. Trains cannot yield to cars, so you must let them pass before crossing the tracks.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: You must drive slowly and sound your horn.
questions.answerB: A bus stop is ahead.
questions.answerC: You are entering a school's parking lot.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are used to warn drivers about upcoming hazardous conditions and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign tells drivers that they are approaching a school zone and that they should slow down and watch for children.

questions.question: Bicyclists are required to:
questions.answerA: Obey traffic signs, signals, and laws.
questions.answerB: Ride on the sidewalk in business districts.
questions.answerC: Ride in the center of traffic lanes.
questions.explanation: Bicycles are legally considered vehicles with the same rights and responsibilities as other vehicles. Bicyclists are required to obey all traffic signs, signals, and regulations.

questions.question: When driving on slick roads, you should:
questions.answerA: Take turns more slowly than usual.
questions.answerB: Change lanes quickly.
questions.answerC: Accelerate quickly.
questions.explanation: While it is always dangerous to drive too fast on slippery roads, this is especially true when driving in turns and curves. Be sure to approach them more slowly in slippery conditions than you would under normal circumstances.

questions.question: Defensive driving is:
questions.answerA: Identifying dangerous driving situations and taking action to avoid accidents.
questions.answerB: Defending yourself against poor drivers by getting ahead of them in traffic.
questions.answerC: Following the vehicle ahead of you at a close distance.
questions.answerD: Quickly changing lanes and shifting in and out of traffic congestion.
questions.explanation: You drive defensively when you identify dangerous driving situations and take action before an accident occurs. Defensive driving helps prevent conflicts with aggressive, offensive, discourteous, careless, inattentive, impulsive, ignorant, or intoxicated drivers or pedestrians.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Don't drink if you are going to drive.
questions.answerB: Slippery when wet.
questions.answerC: Road curves ahead.
questions.explanation: This sign warns that the road is slippery when wet.

questions.question: If you see this sign, you:
questions.answerA: Should maintain your vehicle’s speed until you enter the reduced speed zone.
questions.answerB: Should begin to reduce your vehicle’s speed.
questions.answerC: Should not slow down because traffic will start to back up.
questions.answerD: May reduce your speed, if you choose to do so.
questions.explanation: "Reduced speed ahead" signs inform drivers that they should begin to reduce the speed of their vehicles. The new speed limit will begin at the next speed limit sign.

questions.question: What does a single dashed yellow line separating traffic mean?
questions.answerA: Drivers may pass if it is safe to do so.
questions.answerB: Both lanes travel in the same direction.
questions.answerC: Drivers may not pass.
questions.answerD: Drivers may pass, even if it could be dangerous.
questions.explanation: Yellow lines separate traffic moving in opposite directions. A single dashed yellow line in the center of a road indicates that vehicles traveling in both directions are permitted to pass. Drivers may only begin a pass if they will not interfere with any oncoming traffic.

questions.question: If you miss your exit on an interstate expressway:
questions.answerA: Stop and make a U-turn.
questions.answerB: Get off at the next exit and come back to the exit you missed.
questions.answerC: Roll down your window and ask the driver next to you for help.
questions.explanation: If you miss your turn or exit, do not back up or try to turn around on the highway. Go to the next exit and safely turn around.

questions.question: An "End school zone" sign indicates:
questions.answerA: That the speed limit is 20 mph.
questions.answerB: The beginning of a reduced speed zone.
questions.answerC: The increased possibility of encountering pedestrians.
questions.answerD: The end of a reduced speed zone.
questions.explanation: Do not exceed the school zone speed limit during indicated times. The end of a reduced speed school zone will be indicated by an "End school zone" regulatory sign.

questions.question: When is it illegal to drive below the speed limit?
questions.answerA: When driving slowly disrupts the normal flow of traffic
questions.answerB: When in heavy traffic in a construction zone
questions.answerC: Only when driving in rural areas.
questions.answerD: When driving under adverse weather conditions
questions.explanation: It is illegal to drive so slowly that you disrupt the normal flow of traffic. You may receive a citation for driving too slowly.

questions.question: When passing on a multilane highway:
questions.answerA: Be sure the passing lane is clear.
questions.answerB: Pass only on the right.
questions.answerC: Watch for oncoming traffic.
questions.answerD: There is no need to signal.
questions.explanation: Before passing, you must make sure the passing lane is clear and give the proper turn signal to show you are going to change lanes.

questions.question: When approaching a railroad crossing, you should:
questions.answerA: Slow down.
questions.answerB: Look for a train.
questions.answerC: Be ready to stop.
questions.explanation: When you see any signs indicating a nearby railroad crossing, you should slow down, look for a train, and be ready to stop. If the red warning lights are flashing or the gate is down, you must stop 15 to 50 feet before the railroad tracks. Do not try to go around the gate.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: Hunting area.
questions.answerB: State park.
questions.answerC: Deer crossing.
questions.explanation: This sign warns that deer cross the roadway in the area. You should slow down, be alert, and be ready to stop.

questions.question: An octagonal sign is always a:
questions.answerA: Speed limit sign.
questions.answerB: Stop sign.
questions.answerC: Hospital sign.
questions.explanation: Octagonal signs are always stop signs. Come to a complete stop when approaching a red, eight-sided sign.

questions.question: When entering a street from a driveway, you:
questions.answerA: Must drive slowly to allow approaching vehicles and pedestrians time to get out of your way.
questions.answerB: Must honk your horn so approaching vehicles and pedestrians know to give you room.
questions.answerC: Must stop and proceed only when there are no pedestrians or vehicles approaching.
questions.answerD: Can disregard any pedestrians if there is no sidewalk.
questions.explanation: Always stop before entering the roadway from a driveway and yield to any approaching vehicles or crossing pedestrians. The stop should be made before crossing the sidewalk area. Failure to stop is unlawful.

questions.question: If you want to get off the freeway but you have missed your exit, you should:
questions.answerA: Go to the next exit.
questions.answerB: Make a U-turn through the median.
questions.answerC: Pull onto the shoulder and back your car to the exit.
questions.answerD: Flag down a police officer for an escort back to your exit.
questions.explanation: If you miss your exit, you should take the next exit. Do not stop or back up on the highway, swerve across multiple lanes to try to make the exit at the last second, or cross over the median to turn around. All of these maneuvers are illegal and extremely dangerous.

questions.question: When approaching a traffic signal displaying a flashing yellow arrow, drivers:
questions.answerA: Should merge into a lane in the direction of the arrow.
questions.answerB: Should come to a complete stop.
questions.answerC: May turn left after yielding to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.
questions.answerD: Have the right-of-way and may expect oncoming traffic to stop for them.
questions.explanation: A flashing yellow arrow indicates that left turns are allowed in the direction of the arrow. However, the oncoming traffic has a green light and you must yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: The highway ahead curves only to the right.
questions.answerB: The highway ahead turns sharply to the right.
questions.answerC: The highway ahead curves to the right and then to the left.
questions.answerD: The highway ahead curves to the left and then to the right.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are used to warn drivers about upcoming hazardous conditions and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers that the road ahead curves to the right and then to the left.

questions.question: Your blind spot is the area of the road:
questions.answerA: You cannot see without moving your head.
questions.answerB: Directly behind your vehicle.
questions.answerC: You see in your rearview mirror.
questions.answerD: You see in your side mirror.
questions.explanation: Blind spots are areas that a driver cannot see without moving their head. They can be located to the sides of and behind a vehicle.

questions.question: Before switching on the ignition, you should:
questions.answerA: Be sure only backseat passengers have buckled their seat belts.
questions.answerB: Be sure only adult passengers have buckled their seat belts.
questions.answerC: Be sure only child passengers have buckled their seat belts.
questions.answerD: Be sure all of the vehicle's occupants have buckled their seat belts.
questions.explanation: Develop a routine for entering and leaving your car. Before switching on the ignition, buckle your safety belt and see that all passengers do likewise.

questions.question: Which of the following equipment may you have installed on your private vehicle?
questions.answerA: A blue light visible outside of the vehicle
questions.answerB: A bell, exhaust whistle, or siren
questions.answerC: A muffler cut-out or by-pass
questions.explanation: Adding a bell, exhaust whistle, or siren to your motor vehicle is prohibited. You may not add a red light that is visible from the front of your vehicle or a blue light that is visible outside of the vehicle. You may not add a muffler cut-out, muffler bypass, or any muffler that makes more noise than the vehicle's original equipment.

questions.question: When driving under icy or snowy conditions, which driving technique will help drivers avoid crashes?
questions.answerA: Add extra weight to their vehicles to improve traction.
questions.answerB: Get off the highways as quickly as possible.
questions.answerC: Engage the four-wheel drive on their vehicles.
questions.answerD: Reduce their speed and increase their following distance.
questions.explanation: Reduce your speed when roads are snow-covered or icy. Doing this and increasing your following distance are the most important techniques for avoiding crashes under snowy or icy conditions.

questions.question: Passing is prohibited:
questions.answerA: On hills and curves.
questions.answerB: At intersections.
questions.answerC: At railroad crossings.
questions.explanation: Locations where it is unlawful and unsafe to pass another vehicle include hills, curves, intersections, and railroad crossings.

questions.question: You are driving when your power steering stops working. You should:
questions.answerA: Honk your horn and turn off the ignition.
questions.answerB: Turn on your hazard lights and brace yourself.
questions.answerC: Work hard to steer, reduce your speed, drive to a safe area, and stop.
questions.explanation: If your power steering stops working, additional effort will be required to maintain steering control. Reduce your speed and pull off the roadway to stop in a safe area.

questions.question: Double solid yellow lines painted down the middle of the road mean:
questions.answerA: Railroad crossing ahead.
questions.answerB: Pedestrian crossing ahead.
questions.answerC: Passing is not permitted from either direction.
questions.answerD: Passing is permitted from either direction.
questions.explanation: Double solid yellow lines in the center of the road mean that passing is not allowed from either direction. You may not cross the lines unless you are making a left turn or passing pedestrians, bicyclists, and riders of scooters or skateboards when the opposite lane is clear and you can pass safely.

questions.question: When you take a road test for a driver license:
questions.answerA: You must provide the vehicle.
questions.answerB: The vehicle must be in safe operating condition, free of safety defects.
questions.answerC: You must be accompanied to the testing station by a licensed driver.
questions.explanation: You must be accompanied to the testing station by a licensed driver and provide a vehicle in safe operating condition with a current safety inspection certificate and no-fault insurance card. All vehicle safety defects must be corrected prior to taking the test.

questions.question: While driving, you come upon a sign displaying the words “Reduced speed, 35 mph." This means:
questions.answerA: That the new 35 mph speed limit begins at this sign.
questions.answerB: That the new 35 mph speed limit begins at the next speed limit sign.
questions.answerC: That you have plenty of time to slow down before the reduced speed zone.
questions.answerD: That you should reduce your speed to 35 mph, but only under poor weather conditions.
questions.explanation: "Reduced speed" signs inform drivers that they must reduce their speeds. If a new speed limit is posted on one of these signs, the new speed limit begins at the sign.

questions.question: The “No zone” is:
questions.answerA: A term used to describe blind spots around a truck or bus.
questions.answerB: A special speed zone.
questions.answerC: A roadway with restrictions on vehicle stereo volume.
questions.answerD: The television show that replaced The Twilight Zone.
questions.explanation: A truck or bus has blind spots on each side, in the rear, and in the front. An automobile cannot be seen in these blind spots. These blind spots are referred to as the “No zone.”

questions.question: If someone is driving aggressively behind you, you should:
questions.answerA: Try to get out of the aggressive driver’s way.
questions.answerB: Stare at the driver as he or she is passing you.
questions.answerC: Speed up as he or she is passing you.
questions.explanation: If you encounter an aggressive driver, you should make every attempt to get out of their way. You should avoid making eye contact with a hostile driver. Challenging a hostile driver by speeding up may only make them angrier, thereby increasing their danger.

questions.question: When driving to an unfamiliar area, you:
questions.answerA: Should depend on road signs to find your way.
questions.answerB: Should plan your trip in advance.
questions.answerC: Only have to know generally where your destination is.
questions.answerD: Should always choose the most direct route.
questions.explanation: When driving to an unfamiliar area, plan your trip in advance. Don’t start with only a hazy idea of where you are going. If your destination is in an unfamiliar area, check the location on a map before you start to drive.

questions.question: A speed limit sign is posted on a freeway exit ramp. You should:
questions.answerA: Slow to this speed before entering the deceleration lane.
questions.answerB: Regard the posted limit as only a suggestion.
questions.answerC: Never drive slower than the posted speed on the exit ramp.
questions.answerD: Slow to the posted speed once entering the exit ramp.
questions.explanation: When exiting the freeway, maintain your speed until you are completely into the exit ramp, then slow down smoothly. Treat a posted speed limit sign on a freeway exit ramp as you would any other speed limit sign.

questions.question: When approaching a school bus stopped with its stop arm extended, drivers should:
questions.answerA: Come to a complete stop and wait to proceed.
questions.answerB: Honk their horn before passing the bus on its left.
questions.answerC: Continue driving when they think most kids are probably done exiting the bus.
questions.answerD: Pass the bus before its door opens.
questions.explanation: When approaching a stopped school bus that is using its stop signal, a driver is required to come to a complete stop. They should not proceed until the stop arm is withdrawn.

questions.question: You are coming to a railroad crossing where the crossing signals are flashing. You should:
questions.answerA: Stop and look for a train.
questions.answerB: Slow down and look for a train.
questions.answerC: Look for a train, then speed up.
questions.answerD: Do what the vehicle ahead of you does.
questions.explanation: When approaching a railroad crossing, you must stop your vehicle no closer than 15 feet from the nearest rail if an installed electric or mechanical signal is giving warning of an approaching train. Be aware of other warning signs that may indicate an oncoming train, including seeing a lowered crossing gate or hearing an oncoming train.

questions.question: If you see this sign, you:
questions.answerA: Must not pass another vehicle.
questions.answerB: May pass a slow-moving vehicle if you can do so quickly.
questions.answerC: May pass if you know the road ahead.
questions.answerD: May pass, but only at night.
questions.explanation: Regulatory signs are white, rectangular signs with black markings. Drivers must obey the instructions posted on all regulatory signs. Where this sign is posted, it is prohibited for drivers to pass one another.

questions.question: It is best to keep a space cushion:
questions.answerA: Only in back of your vehicle.
questions.answerB: Only on the left and right sides of your vehicle.
questions.answerC: Only in front of the vehicle.
questions.answerD: On all sides of the vehicle.
questions.explanation: To ensure that you will have time to react to hazards on the roadway, it is best to keep a cushion of space on all sides of your vehicle. Do not crowd vehicles to your left and right sides.

questions.question: If you drive a heavy truck or bus on the highway, you:
questions.answerA: Are responsible for giving proper consideration to other highway users.
questions.answerB: Can use that additional size of your vehicle to your advantage in traffic.
questions.answerC: Can expect smaller vehicles to stay out of your way.
questions.answerD: Are responsible only for your truck and its cargo.
questions.explanation: Due to their size and weight, large trucks and buses can cause great damage and injury when involved in an accident. The drivers of these vehicles must be constantly aware of the limitations and potential of their vehicles and recognize their responsibility to give proper consideration to other highway users, as well as to their passengers and cargo.

questions.question: Two solid white lines painted across a traffic lane show the boundaries of a crosswalk. As a driver, you should know that:
questions.answerA: Motor vehicles have the right-of-way over pedestrians in crosswalks.
questions.answerB: When pedestrians are in crosswalks, they should be given the right-of-way.
questions.answerC: No one has the right-of-way in a crosswalk.
questions.answerD: Pedestrians are responsible to stay out of the way of all traffic.
questions.explanation: Crosswalk lines show pedestrians where to safely cross a road or street. Crosswalks may be marked by horizontal lines, vertical lines, or a combination of the two. You must always stop for pedestrians who are in a crosswalk.

questions.question: Alcohol:
questions.answerA: Slows reflexes and reaction time.
questions.answerB: Puts you to sleep.
questions.answerC: Wakes you up.
questions.explanation: Alcohol is a depressant drug that slows the activity of the brain and reduces the skills that you need for safe driving. Drinking alcohol results in slowed reaction time and impaired judgment.

questions.question: You are driving on a busy street and your vehicle’s accelerator sticks open. You should:
questions.answerA: Blow your horn.
questions.answerB: Slam on your brakes.
questions.answerC: Turn on your four-way flashers.
questions.answerD: Turn off your ignition, taking care not to engage the steering wheel locking mechanism.
questions.explanation: If your vehicle’s accelerator sticks open, your vehicle will continue to maintain its speed or accelerate, even if you remove your foot from the gas pedal. Turn off the ignition, using care to move the ignition switch only far enough to stop the engine and not engage the steering wheel locking mechanism. Apply your brakes and move off the road to a safe area.

questions.question: The most important thing in any driving situation is:
questions.answerA: The vehicle.
questions.answerB: The environment.
questions.answerC: The driver.
questions.explanation: Every driving situation involves three basic elements: the environment, the vehicle, and the driver. Of these three elements, only you as a driver have the ability to gather information about the existing situation. Apply your skills, knowledge, experience, and judgment, and take any action required to safely complete the driving task.

questions.question: When parking your vehicle downhill on a two-way street:
questions.answerA: Turn your wheels to the right.
questions.answerB: Turn your wheels to the left.
questions.answerC: Keep your wheels pointed straight ahead.
questions.explanation: When you park on a downward-facing slope, turn your wheels sharply toward the side of the road. This way, if your vehicle starts to roll downhill, it will roll away from traffic.

questions.question: Which of the following statements about railroad crossings is true?
questions.answerA: It is against the law to go around lowered gates at a crossing.
questions.answerB: You must stop at a railroad crossing when directed to do so by a flagger.
questions.answerC: Not all railroad crossings are equipped with flashing red signals and gates.
questions.explanation: You must stop at a railroad crossing when directed to do so by a flagger, stop sign, or warning devices, such as gates or flashing lights. Not all railroad crossings are equipped with such devices. It is against the law to drive around lowered railroad crossing gates.

questions.question: Traffic signals sometimes display arrows to control turns from specific lanes. A solid red arrow:
questions.answerA: Is never used as a traffic signal.
questions.answerB: Has the same meaning as a circular red traffic light.
questions.answerC: Means that drivers may turn in the direction indicated by the arrow.
questions.answerD: Means that the traffic the arrow is pointing toward must stop.
questions.explanation: A solid red arrow in a traffic signal means the same thing as a circular red traffic light. When an arrow is red, traffic in the indicated lane must stop and may not turn in the direction that the arrow is pointing.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: All traffic must turn left.
questions.answerB: No left turn.
questions.answerC: No U-turn.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that left turns are prohibited.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: Bicycle crossing.
questions.answerB: Stop only if other cars are approaching.
questions.answerC: Bicycle store.
questions.explanation: This sign (with the arrow below) indicates the location of a bicycle crossing/path. Drive with caution around this sign because bicycles likely regularly cross or ride beside traffic in the area.

questions.question: When towing a trailer or a house trailer, you should:
questions.answerA: Have someone ride in the trailer to keep the load steady.
questions.answerB: Allow only adults to ride in the trailer.
questions.answerC: Never allow anyone to ride in the trailer.
questions.answerD: Allow people to ride in house trailers only.
questions.explanation: You should not permit passengers to ride in trailers. Riding in trailers of any kind is prohibited.

questions.question: What is the first thing you should adjust, if needed, when you get into a car to drive?
questions.answerA: Your seat belt
questions.answerB: The steering wheel
questions.answerC: Your rearview mirror
questions.explanation: When preparing to drive, you should first adjust your seat to ensure that you are in a comfortable position and can see the road clearly. Adjust your mirrors and steering wheel to be effective when your seat is fully adjusted.

questions.question: When towing a loaded trailer that weighs more than one-half of the towing vehicle's weight, or is 3,000 pounds or more, the trailer must be equipped with:
questions.answerA: Brakes.
questions.answerB: Breakaway protection.
questions.answerC: Hub caps.
questions.explanation: If your loaded trailer weighs more than half the weight of the towing vehicle, or is 3,000 pounds or more, the trailer must be equipped with brakes and breakaway protection.

questions.question: Increasing your vehicle’s speed:
questions.answerA: Increases your field of vision.
questions.answerB: Decreases your field of vision.
questions.answerC: Makes it easier to see cross traffic.
questions.answerD: Has no effect on your field of vision.
questions.explanation: The faster you drive, the smaller your field of vision becomes. As your speed increases and your field of vision decreases, you must be extra alert to potential hazards.

questions.question: An arrow painted on the pavement means:
questions.answerA: Drivers in the proper lane may make the movement indicated by the arrow, if they choose to do so.
questions.answerB: Drivers in the proper lane must make the movement indicated by the arrow, but only if traffic lights are not working.
questions.answerC: Drivers in the proper lane must always come to a complete stop before making the movement indicated by the arrow.
questions.answerD: Drivers in the proper lane must make the movement indicated by the arrow while following directions indicated by traffic signals.
questions.explanation: An arrow painted on the pavement within a traffic lane indicates that drivers in the lane must make the movement indicated by the arrow. Drivers should follow directions given by any traffic signs or signals before proceeding in the direction indicated by the arrow.

questions.question: Allowing a space cushion between your vehicle and its surroundings is important because it:
questions.answerA: Prevents distractions from other vehicles.
questions.answerB: Allows you time to react to unexpected situations.
questions.answerC: Keeps traffic flowing at a safe pace.
questions.explanation: The only way to be sure you will have enough time to react to mistakes made by other drivers is to leave plenty of space between you and the vehicles around you.

questions.question: If you change your name, you must notify the county examiner of drivers within:
questions.answerA: 60 days.
questions.answerB: 20 days.
questions.answerC: 10 days.
questions.explanation: Whenever you change your address, you must provide the county examiner of drivers with your new address, your name, and driver license number. This must be done in writing and within 30 days of the change. A change of name requires you to appear in person at the appropriate office within 30 days with proof of the change.

questions.question: If worried, nervous, angry, or crying, a driver:
questions.answerA: Will drive no differently than they would if they were thinking more clearly.
questions.answerB: Can drive faster because they are more in touch with their senses.
questions.answerC: Should take the time to focus on driving before starting the engine.
questions.answerD: Should call a friend to vent while driving.
questions.explanation: You may not be able to drive well if you are worried, excited, crying, angry, or depressed. Emotions can distract you from your driving because your mind is focused on something else. Take time to calm down and get focused before driving.

questions.question: As a motorist, you should:
questions.answerA: Respect the rights and privileges of bicyclists.
questions.answerB: Allow a bicyclist twice as much room as you think they need.
questions.answerC: Give a bicyclist the right-of-way when you crossing a bike lane.
questions.explanation: Bicycles are legally considered vehicles with the same rights and responsibilities as other vehicles. Look for and yield to bicyclists when crossing bike lanes. When driving a motor vehicle, give bicyclists plenty of space.

questions.question: A speed restriction sign:
questions.answerA: May be ignored in rainy, snowy, or icy conditions.
questions.answerB: Has a triangular shape.
questions.answerC: Is blue with black lettering.
questions.answerD: Shows a recommended speed for a curve or turn.
questions.explanation: Curve and turn warning signs often have attached advisory speed signs that show a recommended driving speed for drivers in the curves and turns. Although a driver may feel comfortable driving at a higher speed in fair weather, they should never do so under rainy, snowy, or icy conditions.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: No left turn.
questions.answerB: No U-turns.
questions.answerC: No exit.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that right turns are prohibited.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Lane ends.
questions.answerB: No right turn.
questions.answerC: Slippery when wet.
questions.explanation: Warning signs prepare drivers for upcoming road conditions and hazards and are usually yellow and black. This sign tells drivers that a lane is ending and that they should prepare to allow traffic to merge safely.

questions.question: ____ greatly increase stopping distances and severity of crashes.
questions.answerA: High speeds
questions.answerB: Slow speeds
questions.answerC: Night drives
questions.explanation: High speeds greatly increase stopping distances and severity of crashes. The faster you drive, the greater the impact or striking power of your vehicle, should you be involved in a collision.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Wildlife crossing.
questions.answerB: School crossing or school zone.
questions.answerC: Pedestrian crossing.
questions.explanation: Five-sided signs indicate there is a school nearby and drivers should be alert to children and pedestrians in or near the road. This sign can indicate either a school crossing or a school zone.

questions.question: You are involved in an accident and your vehicle is blocking traffic. You should:
questions.answerA: Move your vehicle off the traveled portion of the roadway, if possible.
questions.answerB: Not move your vehicle under any circumstances.
questions.answerC: Wait until the police arrive before moving your vehicle.
questions.explanation: After a minor collision, move your vehicle off the traveled portion of the roadway, if possible. Do not leave the scene of an accident without identifying yourself and rendering assistance.

questions.question: When approaching a flashing red traffic light, drivers should:
questions.answerA: Drive through the intersection if there is no crossing traffic.
questions.answerB: Continue driving, as they have the right-of-way.
questions.answerC: Stop if a police officer is nearby.
questions.answerD: Treat the light like a stop sign.
questions.explanation: Flashing red lights are used at dangerous intersections. Treat them like stop signs.

questions.question: Bicyclists:
questions.answerA: May ride side-by-side on roadways.
questions.answerB: May ride two abreast on bike paths, except where signs indicate otherwise.
questions.answerC: Have the right-of-way over pedestrians.
questions.answerD: May ride attached to a vehicle.
questions.explanation: On the roadway, bicyclists must ride single file. They may ride two abreast on a bicycle lane or path if it is wide enough that doing so will not impede traffic.

questions.question: You are borrowing an unfamiliar vehicle from a friend. You should:
questions.answerA: Not put too much thought into it because all vehicles are the same.
questions.answerB: Hide from your friend that you are unfamiliar with the vehicle.
questions.answerC: Disregard any obvious defects to avoid embarrassing your friend.
questions.answerD: Take a few minutes before driving to familiarize yourself with the operation and location of all the vehicle’s equipment.
questions.explanation: When driving an unfamiliar vehicle, take a few minutes before driving to familiarize yourself with the location and operation of the turn signals, hazard warning signals, headlights and beam selector, windshield wipers and washers, brakes, gear selector, and horn. Any defects should be corrected before the vehicle is driven.

questions.question: You are driving on a narrow road when you meet an oncoming vehicle. You must:
questions.answerA: Pull completely off the road and stop.
questions.answerB: Allow the oncoming vehicle at least one-half of the main-traveled portion of the road.
questions.answerC: Demand the other vehicle pull over to make room.
questions.answerD: Turn on your high beam headlights to make sure the other vehicle sees you.
questions.explanation: On narrow roads, you must allow vehicles traveling in the opposite direction at least one-half of the main-traveled portion of the road. Both vehicles must have adequate space in order for the drivers to safely pass one another.

questions.question: When approaching a steady yellow traffic light, drivers should:
questions.answerA: Accelerate to avoid a red light.
questions.answerB: Continue driving, as they have the right-of-way.
questions.answerC: Slow to a stop, unless they are already within the intersection.
questions.answerD: Check to see what the cars next to them are doing.
questions.explanation: A steady yellow traffic light indicates that a red light is about to appear. Stop unless you are already within the intersection.

questions.question: You are driving on a multilane highway and wish to change lanes. You must signal your intentions:
questions.answerA: Immediately before changing lanes.
questions.answerB: Only during the lane change.
questions.answerC: At least 50 feet before beginning to change lanes.
questions.answerD: At least 100 feet before beginning to change lanes.
questions.explanation: Signals must be given for at least 100 feet before changing lanes or turning. This is approximately the length of five cars. It is advisable to signal for a greater distance when driving at higher speeds.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: No right turn.
questions.answerB: Keep right.
questions.answerC: No U-turn.
questions.explanation: Regulation signs regulate traffic speed and movement, displaying rules which drivers must obey. This regulation sign means that right turns are prohibited.

questions.question: To prepare for anything coming up on the road ahead, you should:
questions.answerA: Continually scan the entire road and all roadsides.
questions.answerB: Stare straight ahead at all times.
questions.answerC: Drive with your left foot resting lightly on the brake pedal.
questions.answerD: Maintain focus toward the middle of the road.
questions.explanation: Your ability to handle dangerous traffic situations depends largely on searching for and identifying problems before meeting them. Looking far ahead of your vehicle does not mean you should simply stare at the center of the road. You need to continually scan the entire road, including the sides of the road.

questions.question: You are turning onto a two-lane road divided by a broken yellow line. You know immediately that:
questions.answerA: You are on a two-way road.
questions.answerB: You are on a one-way road.
questions.answerC: The road is under repair.
questions.answerD: You must stay to the left of the broken yellow lines.
questions.explanation: Yellow centerlines are used to separate traffic moving in opposite directions. Broken lines may be crossed to pass slower-moving traffic when it is safe to do so.

questions.question: A red traffic signal light means that you must:
questions.answerA: Stop at the stop line.
questions.answerB: Stop before entering any crosswalk.
questions.answerC: Stop before entering the intersection.
questions.explanation: A red traffic light means that you must stop before entering the intersection. You must at any stop line and before entering any crosswalk.

questions.question: You wish to drive a heavy truck in Hawaii. You must:
questions.answerA: Be at least 21 years old.
questions.answerB: Have a valid driver license for the category of vehicle you wish to drive.
questions.answerC: Have no special qualifications.
questions.answerD: Drive the truck only on truck routes.
questions.explanation: Drivers of large vehicles must hold a valid license for the category of vehicle being driven. Information on all types of driver licenses may be found in the Hawaii Drivers Manual.

questions.question: Which of the following recommendations does not promote safe night driving?
questions.answerA: Keep your windshield clean.
questions.answerB: Be aware that tinted windows reduce visibility in the dark.
questions.answerC: Carry a flashlight in your vehicle.
questions.answerD: Look into the headlights of oncoming vehicles.
questions.explanation: If you look into the headlights of an oncoming vehicle, the pupil of your eye will contract. After the oncoming vehicle has passed, there will be an interval of time during which the pupil must readjust to the less intense light. During this recovery period, you are virtually driving blind.

questions.question: If not otherwise prohibited by a sign, a driver stopped at a solid red traffic light may turn left:
questions.answerA: Onto any street if there are no other vehicles or pedestrians present at the intersection.
questions.answerB: Under no circumstances.
questions.answerC: From a two-way street onto a one-way street.
questions.answerD: From a one-way street onto another one-way street.
questions.explanation: Unless a sign prohibits such movement, you may turn left on a red light from a one-way street onto a one-way street where traffic is moving to the left. Before turning, you must come to a complete stop and be sure there are no vehicles or pedestrians in your path.

questions.question: A yellow and black diamond-shaped sign:
questions.answerA: Warns you about conditions on or near the road.
questions.answerB: Helps direct you to cities and towns ahead.
questions.answerC: Tells you about traffic laws and regulations.
questions.answerD: Tells you about road construction ahead.
questions.explanation: Warning signs, which tell you about conditions on or near the road ahead, are usually diamond-shaped with black symbols or words on a yellow background.

questions.question: If you leave your vehicle unattended, you must:
questions.answerA: Turn off the engine.
questions.answerB: Lock the ignition and remove the key.
questions.answerC: Set the parking brake.
questions.explanation: When you leave your vehicle unattended, you must stop the engine, lock the ignition, remove the key from the ignition, and set the parking brake.

questions.question: What is the appropriate action to take when approaching a railroad crossing that does not have signals to direct traffic?
questions.answerA: Always bring the car to a complete stop.
questions.answerB: Slow down and be prepared to stop.
questions.answerC: All railroad crossings have signals so you will never encounter this situation.
questions.answerD: Increase your speed to get across the tracks quickly.
questions.explanation: When approaching an unmarked railroad crossing, slow down and be prepared to stop. Before you cross, be sure that no trains are approaching from either direction on any track. If you see or hear a train coming, stop at a safe distance from the nearest track and wait to proceed until after the train passes.

questions.question: Certain highway signs require drivers to obey an indicated instruction. Such signs are known as:
questions.answerA: Regulatory signs.
questions.answerB: Warning signs.
questions.answerC: Information signs.
questions.explanation: Regulatory signs require drivers to obey an indicated instruction. Failure to comply is subject to penalty.

questions.question: Stop lines are solid white lines painted across traffic lanes:
questions.answerA: In curves and on hills.
questions.answerB: Next to churches and schools.
questions.answerC: At intersections and pedestrian crosswalks.
questions.explanation: Stop lines are solid white lines painted across traffic lanes at intersections and pedestrian crosswalks. They indicate the exact location at which approaching drivers must stop.

questions.question: When dealing with pedestrians, a driver must:
questions.answerA: Make sure the pedestrian is aware of their vehicle.
questions.answerB: Always yield the right-of-way, even if the pedestrian is in the wrong.
questions.answerC: Yield the right-of-way only when the pedestrian is legally entitled to it.
questions.answerD: Slow down and sound their horn near a crosswalk.
questions.explanation: You must do everything you can to prevent striking a pedestrian or another vehicle, regardless of the circumstances. It is the driver’s basic responsibility to be alert to pedestrians and to yield the right-of-way to all pedestrians, even if the pedestrian is crossing the street where they should not be.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Heavy traffic ahead.
questions.answerB: Do not enter.
questions.answerC: Railroad crossing.
questions.explanation: This sign means that it is not safe for drivers to enter the indicated road or driveway from their current direction. If you come across one of these signs, you should immediately turn around and drive a different way.

questions.question: On long trips, you can prevent drowsiness by:
questions.answerA: Turning on your car radio.
questions.answerB: Slowing down.
questions.answerC: Stopping at regular intervals for a rest.
questions.answerD: Moving your eyes from side to side as you drive.
questions.explanation: To prevent drowsiness on long trips, you should schedule regular stops. Give yourself time to rest and stretch, even if you are not feeling tired.

questions.question: If you change your address from that shown on your vehicle's registration certificate, you:
questions.answerA: Must notify the County Department of Finance when renewing your license.
questions.answerB: Must notify the County Department of Finance within 30 days of the change.
questions.answerC: Must notify the County Department of Finance only when selling or trading your car.
questions.answerD: Do not have to do anything.
questions.explanation: Whenever you change your address, you must provide the county examiner of drivers with your new address, your name, and driver license number. This must be done in writing and within 30 days of the change. A change of name requires you to appear in person at the appropriate office within 30 days with proof of the change.

questions.question: To be safe when crossing a railroad, you should:
questions.answerA: Look both ways, but only when the red light is flashing.
questions.answerB: Listen, look both ways, and then proceed if it is safe to do so.
questions.answerC: Cross especially quickly when a train is approaching.
questions.answerD: Quickly pass under any lowering gates.
questions.explanation: Railroad crossings are always dangerous. Drivers should look and listen for an approaching train coming from either direction before proceeding across the tracks. Watch for signals indicating an approaching train and never proceed until you are certain it is safe to do so.

questions.question: When passing a motorcycle, you must:
questions.answerA: Allow the motorcyclist the right half of a traffic lane.
questions.answerB: Allow the motorcyclist the entire width of a traffic lane.
questions.answerC: Begin moving past the motorcycle before your vehicle is entirely in the passing lane.
questions.explanation: Give motorcyclists, bicyclists, and pedestrians plenty of space. Use extra caution when making turns or changing lanes near one of these road users. A motorcyclist is entitled to the entire width of a traffic lane.

questions.question: When a traffic signal light turns green, you should:
questions.answerA: Yield the right-of-way to pedestrians.
questions.answerB: Accelerate as quickly as possible.
questions.answerC: Back up slowly.
questions.answerD: Not move until another driver waves you on.
questions.explanation: A green light tells you that you can go through the intersection. However, you must first yield the right-of-way to traffic and pedestrians who are still in the intersection.

questions.question: What happens if you drink alcohol while taking prescription or over-the-counter medicine?
questions.answerA: The medicine reduces the effect of the alcohol.
questions.answerB: The alcohol will help the medicine cure a cold.
questions.answerC: The combination could multiply the effects of the alcohol or medicine.
questions.answerD: There is no effect because they are different substances.
questions.explanation: Consuming alcohol and other drugs together can increase the impairing effects of both. For example, having one drink while you are also using a cold remedy could affect you as much as several drinks would when being consumed separately from any medications.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Side road.
questions.answerB: Low clearance.
questions.answerC: Merging traffic.
questions.explanation: Warning signs prepare drivers for upcoming road conditions and hazards and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign tells drivers to be aware of potential traffic entering from an upcoming side road.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Four-lane traffic ahead.
questions.answerB: Divided highway ahead.
questions.answerC: Two-way traffic ahead.
questions.explanation: This sign warns of two-way traffic ahead.

questions.question: You are approaching an intersection when the traffic light changes from green to solid yellow. You should:
questions.answerA: Consider it the same as a caution sign and continue through the intersection.
questions.answerB: Stop immediately.
questions.answerC: Stop before entering the intersection, unless you are too close to stop safely.
questions.answerD: Speed up to get through the intersection before the red light appears.
questions.explanation: When approaching an intersection with a solid yellow traffic light, slow to a stop before entering the intersection, if it is safe to do so. If you can't stop safely, drive carefully through the intersection.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Stop.
questions.answerB: Side road.
questions.answerC: Two-way left turn.
questions.explanation: Eight-sided traffic signs warn drivers that they must stop and yield the appropriate right-of-way at an intersection. Drivers may proceed when it is safe to do so.

questions.question: Certain highway signs contain information about hazardous conditions. Such signs are known as:
questions.answerA: Regulatory signs.
questions.answerB: Warning signs.
questions.answerC: Information signs.
questions.explanation: Warning signs advise drivers of potentially hazardous conditions. For your own safety, obey warning signs. Disregarding the information provided by a warning sign may result in an accident due to your negligence.

questions.question: A diamond-shaped sign is a:
questions.answerA: Road hazard sign.
questions.answerB: Interstate route sign.
questions.answerC: School crossing sign.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are normally diamond-shaped and yellow, although orange warning signs are used in work areas. Such signs warn that you are approaching a hazardous location or an area where special rules apply.

questions.question: You may pass another vehicle if the line dividing your lane from the lane you wish to enter is a ____ line.
questions.answerA: Broken white
questions.answerB: Double solid yellow
questions.answerC: Solid yellow
questions.explanation: White lines separate traffic lanes traveling in the same direction. You may cross broken white lines to pass, as long as the passing lane is clear.

questions.question: Your vehicle strikes an unattended parked vehicle and you cannot locate the vehicle’s owner. You:
questions.answerA: Have done as much as you can.
questions.answerB: Must stay until the police arrive.
questions.answerC: Must leave a written notice containing your name, your address, and the circumstances of the accident.
questions.explanation: Upon striking an unattended vehicle, stop and try to locate the owner. If you cannot find the owner, leave a written notice containing your name, your address, and the circumstances of the accident.

questions.question: If you change your address, you must notify the county examiner of drivers:
questions.answerA: In writing, within 30 days.
questions.answerB: In writing, within 10 days.
questions.answerC: In person, within 10 days.
questions.explanation: Whenever you change your address, you must provide the county examiner of drivers with your new address, your name, and driver license number. This must be done in writing and within 30 days of the change. A change of name requires you to appear in person at the appropriate office within 30 days with proof of the change.

questions.question: When stopped for a traffic violation or at an equipment check, the driver must produce:
questions.answerA: Proof of insurance.
questions.answerB: Their license.
questions.answerC: Proof of registration.
questions.explanation: When stopped for a traffic violation or at an equipment check, the driver is responsible for producing their license, proof of registration, and proof of insurance. Drivers are required to have all three of these documents in a vehicle when it is being driven.

questions.question: If a crossing guard is directing traffic in a school zone, you must:
questions.answerA: Follow the directions given by the crossing guard.
questions.answerB: Copy what surrounding traffic is doing, despite the crossing guard's instructions.
questions.answerC: Assume the guard is not supposed to be directing traffic.
questions.answerD: Follow rules that would be in place if no children were present.
questions.explanation: Be prepared to reduce your speed and use caution when directed to do so by a sign, crossing guard, or law enforcement officer. Always drive with extra caution in a school zone.

questions.question: A solid yellow line on your side of the centerline means:
questions.answerA: Slow down.
questions.answerB: Pass with caution.
questions.answerC: Do not pass.
questions.explanation: A solid yellow line next to your lane means that passing is not permitted from your direction.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Stop sign ahead.
questions.answerB: Lane closed ahead.
questions.answerC: Railroad crossing ahead.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually diamond-shaped with black markings on a yellow background. They alert drivers to upcoming hazards. This warning sign indicates that a traffic signal is ahead and drivers should prepare to react to a yellow or red light.

questions.question: The mechanical condition of a vehicle is the responsibility of:
questions.answerA: The legal owner of the vehicle.
questions.answerB: The garage mechanic.
questions.answerC: The vehicle driver.
questions.explanation: You are responsible for the condition of the vehicle you are driving, even if you are not the owner of the vehicle. General care and maintenance should be performed regularly on every vehicle.

questions.question: When approaching a flashing yellow light, drivers should:
questions.answerA: Increase their speed.
questions.answerB: Come to a complete stop.
questions.answerC: Turn on their headlights.
questions.answerD: Slow down and proceed with caution.
questions.explanation: A flashing yellow light warns of a hazard. Slow down and proceed with caution.

questions.question: This sign is a:
questions.answerA: Service sign.
questions.answerB: Regulatory sign.
questions.answerC: Warning sign.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually diamond-shaped and yellow with black lettering or symbols. They warn drivers about special situations or potential hazards ahead.

questions.question: You are driving on a divided multilane highway and see or hear the signal of an approaching emergency vehicle. You should:
questions.answerA: Disregard the signal if there are other lanes available for the emergency vehicle.
questions.answerB: Stop as quickly as you can.
questions.answerC: Slow down, move your vehicle to provide a clear path for the emergency vehicle, and stop.
questions.answerD: Increase your speed to get out of the way of the emergency vehicle.
questions.explanation: If you hear the siren or see the flashing lights of an emergency vehicle, you must slow down, provide a clear path for the vehicle, and stop. Don't try to outdrive the emergency vehicle.

questions.question: If a driver sees an animal on the roadway:
questions.answerA: No special action is required.
questions.answerB: The driver should honk their horn.
questions.answerC: The driver should pass the animal as closely as possible.
questions.answerD: The driver should be very cautious.
questions.explanation: Be very cautious any time you encounter an animal on the roadway. Pass the animal slowly to avoid startling or frightening it.

questions.question: When changing lanes you should not:
questions.answerA: Check your side and rearview mirrors.
questions.answerB: Give a turn signal to signal your intentions.
questions.answerC: Check for other drivers who may be moving into the same lane as you.
questions.answerD: Use your cell phone to contact the police to determine if the road ahead is clear.
questions.explanation: Before changing lanes, check your side and rearview mirrors for traffic approaching you from behind. Use your turn signal to let other drivers know you plan to change lanes. Check for other drivers who also may be moving into the same lane.

questions.question: If another driver cuts you off in traffic, you should:
questions.answerA: Pull next to the driver and yell at them.
questions.answerB: Let it go.
questions.answerC: Flash your high beams at the driver.
questions.answerD: Get back at the other driver by cutting them off.
questions.explanation: To avoid the dangers of road rage, you should never take it personally if another driver cuts you off in traffic. Just let it go and continue driving safely.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Railroad crossing.
questions.answerB: One-way traffic.
questions.answerC: Limited parking.
questions.explanation: Circular traffic signs indicate upcoming railroad crossings. This sign tells drivers that they are approaching a railroad crossing and should be looking for signs of an oncoming train.

questions.question: Signaling your intentions before turning, changing lanes, or driving away from a curb:
questions.answerA: Is necessary only if other traffic is present.
questions.answerB: Is a good driving habit and is required by law.
questions.answerC: Is necessary only during the maneuver, not before.
questions.answerD: Is not necessary if the maneuver is done slowly.
questions.explanation: When changing lanes or turning, signal your intentions well in advance. The law requires that you signal for at least 100 feet before you move your vehicle to the right or left. Before pulling away from a curb, always signal to inform passing drivers of your intentions.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: A divided highway ends.
questions.answerB: A one-way street begins.
questions.answerC: A one-way street ends.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that the road ahead becomes a divided highway. Keep to the right of the divider or median.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Animal crossing.
questions.answerB: School crossing.
questions.answerC: Pedestrian crossing.
questions.explanation: Five-sided signs indicate there is a school nearby and drivers should be alert to children and pedestrians in or near the road. This sign indicates a school crossing. Drivers must obey any instructions given by a crossing guard.

questions.question: Follow the vehicle ahead of you at a distance of at least:
questions.answerA: One second.
questions.answerB: Two seconds.
questions.answerC: 100 feet.
questions.explanation: Vehicles being struck from behind is a common occurrence on the roadways. To avoid this hazard, leave a minimum two-second interval of space between you and the vehicle ahead of you.

questions.question: If your vehicle begins to skid, you should:
questions.answerA: Overcorrect.
questions.answerB: Turn your steering wheel into traffic.
questions.answerC: Turn your steering wheel in the direction you want to go.
questions.explanation: If your vehicle begins to skid, remain calm. Steer in the direction that you want to go and try not to overcorrect.

questions.question: Drugs may interfere with a person’s ability to drive safely:
questions.answerA: Only if the drugs are not prescribed by a doctor.
questions.answerB: Only when taken while drinking.
questions.answerC: Only when the person is driving at night.
questions.answerD: Even if the drugs are prescribed by a doctor.
questions.explanation: Many medicines interfere with a person’s ability to drive safely. Before beginning a regimen of any medication, it is important to ask your doctor about possible side effects that could affect your driving ability.

questions.question: What are the colors of signs that tell you the distance to the next exit on a highway?
questions.answerA: Yellow with black letters
questions.answerB: Black with white letters
questions.answerC: Red with white letters
questions.explanation: Signs providing information about destinations are green with white letters or symbols.

questions.question: An arrogant driver is a driver who:
questions.answerA: Is purposely in a hurry and competing with other traffic.
questions.answerB: Shows little or no respect for traffic laws or the rights of other drivers and pedestrians.
questions.answerC: You should try to avoid while driving.
questions.explanation: An arrogant driver is purposely in a hurry and competing with other drivers sharing the road. Arrogant drivers have little or no respect for traffic laws or the rights of other drivers and pedestrians. Never allow yourself to become involved in competition with an arrogant driver.

questions.question: Distracted drivers are at a greater risk of a crash when they are using which of the following?
questions.answerA: CD player
questions.answerB: Radio
questions.answerC: Cell phone
questions.explanation: Using a cell phone (including a hands-free phone) or any kind of audio device (including a radio or CD player) can be a dangerous distraction and contributes to the risk of a crash.

questions.question: When you hear a fire engine siren behind you, you must:
questions.answerA: Slow down until it passes you.
questions.answerB: Drive with your flashers on.
