questions.answerC: Pull over to the side of the road and stop.
questions.answerD: Speed up and take the nearest exit.
questions.explanation: When you hear the siren of an emergency vehicle, you must pull over to the curb or side of the road and stop.

questions.question: On the freeway, you see a "Merging traffic“ sign. You should:
questions.answerA: Honk at incoming traffic.
questions.answerB: Always remain at your present speed.
questions.answerC: Speed up to avoid congesting traffic.
questions.answerD: Move to another lane, if safe, to let traffic enter.
questions.explanation: When on a roadway with two or more lanes, you should make room for entering vehicles. If there is no one driving next to you, move over one lane.

questions.question: Braking distance is affected by:
questions.answerA: The speed your vehicle is traveling.
questions.answerB: The condition of your brakes and tires.
questions.answerC: The condition of the pavement.
questions.explanation: Factors that can affect braking distance include how fast your vehicle is traveling, the condition of your brakes and tires, and the condition of the pavement.

questions.question: Having a few drinks before driving home after work:
questions.answerA: Is good because you will miss rush-hour traffic.
questions.answerB: Is good because the drinks will help release the day’s tension and make you a safer driver.
questions.answerC: Should be avoided because the drinks may make you a dangerous driver.
questions.explanation: Driving a motor vehicle while under the influence of alcohol is prohibited in Hawaii. Alcohol slows normal reflexes, interferes with judgment, reduces alertness, and impairs vision. If you feel stimulated after drinking, it is simply because your inhibitions are lowered, causing a loss of caution and self-control. It is safest to refrain from driving when you have consumed any quantity of alcohol.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Slippery when wet.
questions.answerB: Watch for drunk drivers.
questions.answerC: Dangerous curve ahead.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually diamond-shaped with black markings on a yellow background. They alert drivers to upcoming hazards. This sign warns drivers to be extra careful when the pavement is wet because the road may become slippery, making vehicles more difficult to control.

questions.question: A vehicle using emergency signals is approaching from the opposite direction on a two-lane street. You should:
questions.answerA: Stop as quickly as you can.
questions.answerB: Slow down, move as far to the right as possible, and stop.
questions.answerC: Disregard the emergency vehicle because it is going in the opposite direction.
questions.explanation: If you hear the siren or see the flashing lights of an emergency vehicle, you must slow down, provide a clear path for the vehicle, and stop. Don't try to outdrive the emergency vehicle. This law applies on any two-lane street, even if the emergency vehicle is approaching from the opposite direction.

questions.question: You may drink alcoholic beverages in a vehicle on a public highway:
questions.answerA: As long as you aren't driving.
questions.answerB: If you are riding in the back seat.
questions.answerC: If you are riding in the back of a pick-up truck.
questions.explanation: It is against the law to consume or possess any alcoholic beverage while on a public road or sidewalk. Additionally, storing an open alcoholic beverage container in an area of a motor vehicle normally occupied by the driver or passenger is prohibited on any public road.

questions.question: If you need to slow down while driving on a slippery road, the first thing you should do is:
questions.answerA: Firmly apply your brakes.
questions.answerB: Take your foot off the gas pedal.
questions.answerC: Apply your parking brake.
questions.explanation: To slow down on a slippery road, you should first take your foot off the gas pedal. If you need to slow down even more, gently apply a slow, steady pressure to your brake pedal.

questions.question: Two vehicles are driving side by side ahead of your vehicle and you are in a hurry. You should:
questions.answerA: Drive closely behind the vehicle in the left lane and flash your headlights.
questions.answerB: Drive closely behind the vehicle in the right lane.
questions.answerC: Drive in either lane with a two-second time interval between you and the vehicle ahead.
questions.answerD: Quickly switch back and forth between the lanes.
questions.explanation: Always allow at least two seconds of space between you and the vehicle in front of you. This allows you room to react to the actions of other drivers. You must always leave adequate space between vehicles, regardless of if you are in a hurry or not.

questions.question: What should you do if your vehicle’s right wheels leave the pavement?
questions.answerA: Stop quickly.
questions.answerB: Immediately pull all the way off of the road and get back on when it is safe.
questions.answerC: Accelerate and steer back on the road quickly.
questions.answerD: Take your foot off the accelerator, slow down, then ease back onto the road when it is safe to do so.
questions.explanation: If your vehicle’s right wheels leave the pavement, don't panic. Take your foot off the accelerator and steer parallel to the road. Slow down and ease back onto the roadway by keeping both hands on the steering wheel and steering into the road’s right lane with a small turn of the steering wheel. Check for traffic around you before steering back onto the pavement.

questions.question: When your driver license expires, you may:
questions.answerA: Drive during the 90-day grace period.
questions.answerB: Drive as long as you are accompanied by a licensed driver.
questions.answerC: Renew your driver license within a year of the expiration date but may not drive with the expired license.
questions.answerD: Drive to and from work only.
questions.explanation: You may renew your license within six months of its expiration date. Every Hawaii state driver license is void after the expiration date, with no grace period. Your license may be renewed within a year of the expiration date.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: One-way traffic.
questions.answerB: Divided highway ends.
questions.answerC: Two-way traffic.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually diamond-shaped with black markings on a yellow background. They alert drivers to upcoming hazards. This sign indicates that the divided highway is about to end.

questions.question: A “No stopping” sign means that, unless directed to do so by a police officer, you may stop only:
questions.answerA: Long enough to unload packages.
questions.answerB: To avoid conflict with other traffic.
questions.answerC: To discharge passengers.
questions.explanation: A "No stopping" sign means you can only stop to obey a traffic signal, to obey a police officer, or to prevent a conflict with another vehicle.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: No right turns.
questions.answerB: Right turns are permitted.
questions.answerC: Stop before turning right.
questions.explanation: A regulatory sign displaying a red circle with a red slash through the middle indicates that a specific action is prohibited. Right turns are not permitted where this sign is posted.

questions.question: You are driving in the right lane of a multilane highway and want to move into the left lane. You should:
questions.answerA: Look in your rearview mirror for traffic behind you before changing lanes.
questions.answerB: Look over your left shoulder for traffic in your blind spot before changing lanes.
questions.answerC: Look in your side mirror for traffic and turn on your directional signal.
questions.explanation: Before changing lanes, you should always verify that there are no other vehicles in the lane you want to enter by checking your mirrors and looking over your shoulder in the direction you plan to move. You should signal every time you change lanes.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Continue at your current speed.
questions.answerB: You must stop ahead.
questions.answerC: Speeding is not allowed.
questions.answerD: There is a traffic signal ahead.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that there is a traffic signal ahead.

questions.question: You are driving on the roadway and there is an emergency vehicle using its siren and flashing lights directly behind you. You are in heavy traffic and cannot get out of its way. You should:
questions.answerA: Stop where you are.
questions.answerB: Blow your horn.
questions.answerC: Force your way into traffic in the adjoining lane.
questions.answerD: Keep moving slowly until you can get out of its way.
questions.explanation: If an emergency vehicle is directly behind your vehicle while you are in heavy traffic, continue moving slowly until you can get out of its way. When possible, you must clear a path for the emergency vehicle.

questions.question: On a two-lane street, your vehicle is being followed by a fire engine that is not using its emergency signals. You should:
questions.answerA: Continue to drive in a normal manner.
questions.answerB: Stop as quickly as you can.
questions.answerC: Speed up to get out of its way.
questions.answerD: Slow down, move as far to the right as possible, and stop.
questions.explanation: If you are being followed by an emergency vehicle that is not using its siren or flashing lights, you do not need to clear a path. Continue driving in a normal manner.

questions.question: Traffic signs and pavement markings:
questions.answerA: Must always be obeyed.
questions.answerB: Are merely suggestions.
questions.answerC: Must be followed only when there is other traffic.
questions.answerD: Must be followed only when a police officer is present.
questions.explanation: Traffic flow is controlled by pavement markings, traffic islands, signals, and signs. These devices inform drivers of conditions on the roadway and help guide drivers safely to their destinations. You must always obey traffic signs, signals, and pavement markings.

questions.question: You are driving when it begins to rain. You should:
questions.answerA: Drive faster than surrounding traffic.
questions.answerB: Drive at the maximum posted speed limit.
questions.answerC: Slow down.
questions.answerD: Drive closely behind the vehicle in front of you.
questions.explanation: When heavy rain reduces visibility, reduce your speed. Turn on your headlights so other drivers can see your vehicle. If the rain is so heavy that you are unable to see clearly, drive onto the shoulder and stop until the rain lets up.

questions.question: When changing lanes, you should:
questions.answerA: Rely on your mirrors.
questions.answerB: Begin signaling as you move into the next lane.
questions.answerC: Signal at least 500 feet before your lane change when driving on residential streets.
questions.explanation: Other cars and motorcycles are often hidden in a vehicle’s blind spot, so be sure to glance over your shoulder before you begin a lane change. Begin signaling 100 feet before changing lanes or turning in a residential area. Signal five seconds in advance when changing lanes on a freeway.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Watch for drunk drivers.
questions.answerB: Curves ahead.
questions.answerC: Slippery when wet.
questions.explanation: This sign warns that the road is slippery when wet.

questions.question: To practice defensive driving, you should:
questions.answerA: Be aware of developing traffic situations around you.
questions.answerB: Consistently look well ahead of your vehicle and maintain proper following distances.
questions.answerC: Have an alternate plan of action ready.
questions.explanation: Be a defensive driver by looking well ahead of your vehicle and anticipating chain reaction traffic situations. Always have an alternate plan of action ready in case an unexpected event develops. Always maintain the proper following distance and speed for road conditions.

questions.question: When changing lanes, you can check your blind spots by:
questions.answerA: Using the inside rearview mirror.
questions.answerB: Using the outside rearview mirror.
questions.answerC: Using both inside and outside rearview mirrors.
questions.answerD: Turning your head and looking over your shoulder.
questions.explanation: You should turn your head to check your blind spots before every lane change.

questions.question: It is illegal for a person 21 years of age or older to drive with a minimum blood alcohol concentration (BAC) of:
questions.answerA: 0.05 percent.
questions.answerB: 0.08 percent.
questions.answerC: 0.02 percent.
questions.explanation: For drivers age 21 or older, it is illegal to operate a motor vehicle with a blood alcohol concentration (BAC) of 0.08 percent or higher. Driving while under the influence of alcohol is not only illegal, but dangerous.

questions.question: Drowsy drivers:
questions.answerA: Should drink strong black coffee to stay awake.
questions.answerB: Can drive so poorly that they may appear to be drunk.
questions.answerC: Can stay alert by opening a window and turning up the radio.
questions.explanation: Drowsiness can make people drive so poorly that they appear to be drunk. Opening a window, turning on the radio, or drinking coffee is not enough to make a drowsy driver alert to roadway hazards.

questions.question: If two vehicles arrive to a four-way stop at the same time:
questions.answerA: The vehicle on the left must yield to the vehicle on the right.
questions.answerB: The vehicle on the right must yield to the vehicle on the left.
questions.answerC: Drivers must make hand motions to communicate with each other.
questions.answerD: One driver should proceed without stopping.
questions.explanation: In general, vehicles at a four-way stop should proceed in the order that they arrive. However, if two vehicles arrive to the intersection at the same time, the vehicle on the left must yield the right-of-way to the vehicle on the right.

questions.question: Before turning, you should:
questions.answerA: Use your signal.
questions.answerB: Turn the wheel.
questions.answerC: Increase your speed.
questions.explanation: To complete a turn safely, you should activate your turn signal three to four seconds before your turn.

questions.question: You are approaching a railroad crossing and you do not see or hear a train. You must stop:
questions.answerA: If a stop sign is posted.
questions.answerB: If a crossing gate is lowered.
questions.answerC: If the crossing lights are flashing.
questions.explanation: You must always stop before crossing railroad tracks if flashing red lights are activated, a crossing gate is lowered, a stop sign is posted, a flagger signals you to stop, or a train is visible or so close to the crossing that it would be hazardous to continue driving. If you are unsure if a train is too close for you to safely cross the tracks, stop. Never race a train.

questions.question: An approaching driver fails to dim their high beam headlights. Where should you look?
questions.answerA: At the wheels of the approaching vehicle.
questions.answerB: Toward the right side of the road.
questions.answerC: Toward the left side of the road.
questions.answerD: Straight down the middle of the road.
questions.explanation: If an approaching driver fails to dim their high beams, glance toward the right side of the road. This will keep you from being blinded by the other vehicle’s headlights and will allow you to see enough of the road to stay on course until the other vehicle has passed.

questions.question: To check your blind spot when changing lanes to the left, you should glance:
questions.answerA: Over your right shoulder.
questions.answerB: At your side mirror.
questions.answerC: Over your left shoulder.
questions.explanation: To check your blind spot, glance over your shoulder in the direction that you want to move.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: School crossing.
questions.answerB: Pedestrian crossing.
questions.answerC: Jogging trail.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates the presence of a pedestrian crossing. You should watch for people entering a crosswalk or crossing your path. Slow down and be prepared to stop.

questions.question: At a four-way stop:
questions.answerA: The driver to arrive first has the right-of-way.
questions.answerB: The driver to arrive last has the right-of-way.
questions.answerC: One driver should continue driving without stopping.
questions.answerD: One driver should wave the other drivers ahead.
questions.explanation: At four-way stops, traffic from all four directions must stop. The first vehicle to reach the intersection should move forward first. If two vehicles reach the intersection at the same time, the driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Narrow bridge ahead.
questions.answerB: Lane ends or roadway narrows ahead.
questions.answerC: Industrial area.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually diamond-shaped with black markings on a yellow background. They alert drivers to upcoming hazards. This sign warns drivers that the right lane is ending or that the road is narrowing ahead.

questions.question: If you experience a tire blowout:
questions.answerA: Take your foot of the gas.
questions.answerB: Do not immediately use your brakes.
questions.answerC: Gradually slow down and pull off the side of the road.
questions.explanation: If you experience a tire blowout, take your foot off the gas pedal and do not immediately apply the brakes. Gradually slow down before gently applying the brakes and pulling off the side of the road.

questions.question: If you are turning onto a street with more than one lane traveling in your direction, you should:
questions.answerA: Turn into the lane closest to your previous lane.
questions.answerB: Turn into the lane marked with an arrow.
questions.answerC: Turn into the middle lane.
questions.explanation: When turning onto a street with more than one lane moving in the direction that you are traveling, turn into the lane that is closest to your previous lane. Do not change lanes when turning.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Stop ahead.
questions.answerB: Buggy warning.
questions.answerC: Limited parking.
questions.explanation: Warning signs prepare drivers for upcoming road conditions and hazards and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign tells drivers that there is an upcoming stop sign and that they should prepare to come to a complete stop before proceeding.

questions.question: When making a right turn on a green light, you must:
questions.answerA: Maintain your normal driving speed.
questions.answerB: Stop and look for nearby police cars.
questions.answerC: Yield to pedestrians.
questions.explanation: Unless a posted sign prohibits it, you may turn right or left at a steady green light. When turning, you must yield to other vehicles and pedestrians within the intersection.

questions.question: A person's ability to drive can be impaired by:
questions.answerA: Alcohol.
questions.answerB: Any medication.
questions.answerC: A lack of sleep.
questions.explanation: The ability to drive safely is dependent on the driver being in good physical condition. Driving can be impaired by alcohol, legal and illegal drugs, and being drowsy.

questions.question: Drivers may not pass from either side of a ____ centerline.
questions.answerA: Combination solid and broken yellow
questions.answerB: Single broken yellow
questions.answerC: Double solid yellow
questions.explanation: A double solid yellow line down the center of a two-way road means that it is prohibited for traffic from either direction to cross the center to pass.

questions.question: If your car starts to skid, turn your steering wheel:
questions.answerA: To keep the front wheels straight.
questions.answerB: In the direction you want the vehicle to go.
questions.answerC: In the opposite direction of the skid.
questions.answerD: In any direction. It doesn't matter.
questions.explanation: If your vehicle goes into a skid, you should turn the steering wheel in the direction you want the vehicle to go. As soon as the vehicle begins to straighten out, turn the steering wheel back the other way.

questions.question: A broken yellow line alongside a solid yellow line means:
questions.answerA: Passing on the left is permitted from either direction.
questions.answerB: Passing is permitted from the lane next to the broken line.
questions.answerC: Passing is permitted from the lane next to the solid line.
questions.answerD: Passing is not allowed from either direction.
questions.explanation: A broken yellow line alongside a solid yellow line means that passing is allowed from the lane on the side next to the broken line.

questions.question: Bicyclists must refrain from:
questions.answerA: Carrying passengers, unless the bicycle is equipped to do so.
questions.answerB: Riding on the sidewalk in every location.
questions.answerC: Riding at night.
questions.answerD: Riding in the roadway in a business district.
questions.explanation: Bicyclists are not allowed to ride on the sidewalk in business districts. In other areas, bicyclists may ride on sidewalks as long as they stay at speeds of 10 mph or slower and always yield the right-of-way to pedestrians. Bicyclists may ride at night if they have a headlight and rear reflector. Bicyclists should never transport passengers, unless the bicycle is equipped to do so.

questions.question: “Highway hypnosis” is a driving condition that can result from:
questions.answerA: Staring at the roadway for long periods of time.
questions.answerB: Frequent rest stops.
questions.answerC: Too much sleep the night before your trip.
questions.explanation: "Highway hypnosis” happens when you stare straight ahead at the roadway for long periods of time and stop actively scanning ahead, behind, and around your vehicle. This can lead you to zone out, making you very likely to crash into traffic slowing or stopping ahead of you.

questions.question: When towing a trailer large enough to obstruct your inside rearview mirror, you are required to:
questions.answerA: Have an outside rearview mirror installed on the driver’s side of your vehicle.
questions.answerB: Have an outside rearview mirror installed on the side of your vehicle opposite the driver.
questions.answerC: Have outside rearview mirrors installed on both sides of your vehicle.
questions.answerD: Have a person in the vehicle to clear you for right turns.
questions.explanation: If you are towing a trailer that is large enough to obstruct your view of the road through your inside rearview mirror, you must have outside rearview mirrors of proper size installed on your vehicle. These rearview mirrors should be added to both sides of the vehicle.

questions.question: A steady green light at an intersection means that you:
questions.answerA: Must slow down and prepare to stop.
questions.answerB: Must stop and check for oncoming traffic before proceeding.
questions.answerC: May drive through the intersection if the road is clear.
questions.explanation: A steady green light means you may drive through the intersection if the road is clear. You may also turn right or left on a steady green light unless a sign prohibits the turn. When turning, you must yield to other vehicles and pedestrians within the intersection.

questions.question: You notice that the driver in the vehicle ahead of you is driving with one hand and talking to a passenger. You should:
questions.answerA: Give the vehicle extra space.
questions.answerB: Know that the driver in the vehicle ahead is reducing their safety margin by being an inattentive driver.
questions.answerC: Avoid following the driver's example.
questions.explanation: Do not become distracted by looking at passengers, attempting to find something in your vehicle, looking at reading material, sightseeing, or daydreaming while driving. If a driver near you seems distracted, allow them extra space because the risk of an accident is increased by their inattentiveness.

questions.question: You are driving up a hill and are approaching a heavy truck from the rear. You should know that:
questions.answerA: The truck may be traveling at a speed slower than the posted speed limit.
questions.answerB: You may not be able to safely pass the truck.
questions.answerC: You may not be able to legally pass the truck.
questions.explanation: Drivers must be aware that large vehicles often travel at a speed slower than the posted speed limit, especially when driving on an incline, and should use caution when approaching a large vehicle from the rear. When on a hill with limited visibility, it is unlawful to pass another vehicle.

questions.question: You may avoid the risks of alcohol-related crashes by:
questions.answerA: Deciding before you start drinking that you are not going to drive.
questions.answerB: Simply saying, "No thanks, I'm driving," if someone offers you a drink.
questions.answerC: Calling a taxi.
questions.explanation: The only way to avoid the risks of drinking and driving is to decide before you start drinking that you are not going to drive. Because alcohol affects your judgement, it will be harder for you to make safe decisions after you have started drinking.

questions.question: Your vehicle's stopping distance increases when stopping:
questions.answerA: On a wet or icy road.
questions.answerB: On paved highways.
questions.answerC: When driving at night.
questions.explanation: Stopping distances increase on wet or icy roads. Stopping distances also increase on road surfaces covered in loose gravel or stones.

questions.question: When driving near heavy trucks, other drivers and highway users must make allowances for:
questions.answerA: The increased stopping distance required by large vehicles.
questions.answerB: The decreased stopping distance required by large vehicles.
questions.answerC: The decreased noise of larger vehicles.
questions.answerD: The increased speed of larger vehicles.
questions.explanation: When driving near heavy trucks, other drivers and highway users must make allowances for the increased stopping distance required by the large vehicles. Drivers of smaller vehicles should remain in locations where they can be seen by the driver of the large vehicle and where their view of traffic is not blocked by the vehicle.

questions.question: Do not pass:
questions.answerA: On a hill or curve.
questions.answerB: When school bus lights are flashing.
questions.answerC: When approaching an intersection.
questions.explanation: You should never pass if there is an oncoming vehicle in the passing lane, if your view is blocked by a curve or hill, at an intersection, before or on a railroad crossing or bridge, or in any other no passing zone. Unless you are on the opposite side of a multilane roadway with a median or shared center turn lane, you may not pass a stopped school bus that has its flashing red lights activated.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: You are about to enter a one-way street the wrong way.
questions.answerB: School crossing ahead.
questions.answerC: Do not drive in this lane.
questions.answerD: Traffic turning left on the green light must yield to oncoming traffic.
questions.explanation: This sign is used with a traffic signal to tell drivers that left-turning traffic does not have the right-of-way and must instead wait for oncoming traffic to clear.

questions.question: When towing a trailer load, ensure that the trailer’s load is properly balanced. About ____ of the total trailer weight should be on the vehicle’s trailer hitch.
questions.answerA: Five percent
questions.answerB: 10 to 15 percent
questions.answerC: 15 to 20 percent
questions.explanation: About 10 to 15 percent of a trailer's weight should be on the towing vehicle’s trailer hitch. If the weight is poorly distributed, the driver will have trouble controlling the vehicle or trailer.

questions.question: At a school crossing sign, you should:
questions.answerA: Always stop, whether there’s a stop sign or not.
questions.answerB: Watch for children and be ready to stop.
questions.answerC: Always sound your horn when you see children.
questions.answerD: Be ready to help children crossing the street.
questions.explanation: You must always yield to pedestrians who are in or about to enter a crosswalk. Be alert to pedestrians when driving across intersections or turning.

questions.question: To check your blind spot before changing lanes:
questions.answerA: Look into the left side mirror.
questions.answerB: Look into the right side mirror.
questions.answerC: Look into the rearview mirror.
questions.answerD: Look over your shoulder in the direction you plan to move.
questions.explanation: To check your blind spot before changing lanes, you should look over your shoulder in the direction that you plan to move.

questions.question: When turning left at an intersection or into any driveway, you:
questions.answerA: Should leave room on your right for other vehicles to pass.
questions.answerB: Must yield to vehicles approaching from the opposite direction.
questions.answerC: Must not cross any solid yellow line.
questions.answerD: Must not block vehicles approaching from behind your vehicle.
questions.explanation: When turning left, yield to all oncoming traffic that is close enough to be a hazard. You may complete the turn only when the opposite lane is free of hazardous traffic.

questions.question: When towing a trailer, ensure that it is equipped with:
questions.answerA: Properly mounted and lubricated wheels that are covered with fenders or mud guards.
questions.answerB: Tires that are properly inflated.
questions.answerC: The proper lamps and reflectors.
questions.explanation: The wheels of a trailer should be properly mounted and lubricated and must be covered with fenders or mud guards. A trailer should have good tires that are properly inflated. It should be equipped with the proper lamps and reflectors.

questions.question: The effect that alcohol has on your reflexes and judgment:
questions.answerA: Is less pronounced when consuming beer instead of wine.
questions.answerB: Is less pronounced when consuming wine instead of beer.
questions.answerC: Is most pronounced when consuming hard ciders and mixed drinks.
questions.answerD: Depends on the amount of alcohol in your bloodstream.
questions.explanation: Consuming any type of alcohol can have negative effects on your reflexes and judgment. It does not matter which type of alcohol is consumed, only how much alcohol has entered a person's bloodstream.

questions.question: When may you proceed through an intersection that has a stop sign but no stop line or crosswalk?
questions.answerA: After slowing down to verify that there is no cross traffic
questions.answerB: After coming to a complete stop and verifying that it is safe to proceed
questions.answerC: After you have stopped at least 20 feet prior to the intersection
questions.answerD: After slowing down to a speed of 10 mph
questions.explanation: Stop before the stop line or crosswalk at any intersection that is controlled by a stop sign. If there is a stop sign but no stop line or crosswalk, stop before entering the intersection and proceed when it is safe to do so.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: No U-turn.
questions.answerB: No left turn.
questions.answerC: No right turn.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that right turns are prohibited. Do not make a right turn at an intersection where this sign is posted.

questions.question: You notice a vehicle defect which may affect the safe operation of your vehicle. You should:
questions.answerA: Correct the defect as soon as possible.
questions.answerB: Correct the defect when you can afford it.
questions.answerC: Drive the vehicle at slower speeds.
questions.explanation: Any defect that may affect the safe operation of a vehicle should be corrected as soon as possible. Defects should be corrected before the vehicle is driven.

questions.question: You are driving forward out of your driveway. You:
questions.answerA: Must come to a complete stop before crossing the sidewalk area.
questions.answerB: Must slow down before crossing the sidewalk area.
questions.answerC: Have the right-of-way over pedestrians in the sidewalk area.
questions.answerD: Can cross the sidewalk area without stopping if you first honk your horn.
questions.explanation: When driving forward out of a driveway, always stop before entering the road. The stop should be made before crossing the sidewalk area. Failure to stop is unlawful.

questions.question: An intersection has no traffic signs or signals. You arrive at the same time as a vehicle to your right. You should:
questions.answerA: Speed up and get through the intersection.
questions.answerB: Slow down and yield to the vehicle on your right.
questions.answerC: Drive into the intersection and make the other vehicle stop.
questions.answerD: Honk your horn and drive through the intersection.
questions.explanation: When two vehicles arrive to an uncontrolled intersection at the same time, the vehicle on the right has the right-of-way. Once the vehicle on the right has safely passed through the intersection, the other driver may proceed.

questions.question: At dusk or on overcast days, you should:
questions.answerA: Drive using your four-way flashers.
questions.answerB: Drive using your parking lights.
questions.answerC: Not turn on any vehicle lights.
questions.explanation: At dusk or on overcast days, you must turn on your headlights. Dim your lights to their low beam setting when within 1,000 feet of an approaching vehicle and when within 500 feet of a vehicle that you are following. When driving in poor weather, always use your low beams.

questions.question: Your body gets rid of approximately:
questions.answerA: Three alcoholic drinks an hour.
questions.answerB: One alcoholic drink an hour.
questions.answerC: Two alcoholic drinks an hour.
questions.explanation: The average person’s body will process about one alcoholic drink in one hour. However, many factors play a part in determining how impaired a person will become when consuming alcohol, including the amount of alcohol consumed, how fast it is consumed, and a person’s body weight, food intake, and general health.

questions.question: As a pedestrian, you should:
questions.answerA: Always insist on the right-of-way over a vehicle when using a crosswalk.
questions.answerB: Never enter a street or crosswalk when vehicles are approaching.
questions.answerC: Enter a crosswalk at any time because it is the vehicle driver’s responsibility to stop.
questions.answerD: Use crosswalks only if they are convenient.
questions.explanation: Pedestrians should not enter a street or crosswalk when vehicles are approaching. Though pedestrians have the right-of-way in crosswalks, a vehicle approaching from a close distance may not have the time to stop before entering the crosswalk.

questions.question: To ensure that your physical condition does not cause you to drive in an unsafe manner, you should:
questions.answerA: Keep physically fit and have regular physical examinations.
questions.answerB: Know the effect of any medicine on your driving ability.
questions.answerC: Drive within your physical limitations.
questions.explanation: Your physical condition has an important bearing on your ability to drive safely. Drivers should be aware of their physical limitations and only drive if it is safe to do so.

questions.question: You are driving on a highway divided by two solid yellow lines. You may:
questions.answerA: Cross these lines only to make a left turn into or from an alley, private road, or driveway.
questions.answerB: Cross these lines to pass other vehicles, but only if there is no oncoming traffic.
questions.answerC: Cross these lines under no circumstances.
questions.answerD: Cross these lines only to make a U-turn.
questions.explanation: Double solid yellow lines are used to mark roadways where passing is prohibited from both directions. You may cross these lines only to make a left turn into or from an alley, private road, or driveway.

questions.question: A copy of your vehicle inspection certificate:
questions.answerA: Should be kept in the vehicle.
questions.answerB: Should be filed with your income tax return.
questions.answerC: Should be kept in a safe place in your home.
questions.answerD: Will be sent to you by the County Department of Finance.
questions.explanation: All motor vehicles operated on public highways must have an official Periodic Motor Vehicle Inspection (PMVI) at least once a year. Upon approval, a sticker is affixed to the vehicle and two copies of the inspection certificate are issued to you. The certificate must remain in the vehicle.

questions.question: When you see this sign, you must:
questions.answerA: Stop completely and check for pedestrians and cross traffic.
questions.answerB: Slow down without coming to a complete stop.
questions.answerC: Stop completely and wait for a green light.
questions.answerD: Slow down and check for traffic.
questions.explanation: Any eight-sided sign is a stop sign. At an intersection with a stop sign, you must stop completely and check for pedestrians and cross traffic in the intersection. Wait for the intersection to clear before proceeding.

questions.question: If another car is in danger of hitting you, you should:
questions.answerA: Sound your horn.
questions.answerB: Wave your arms.
questions.answerC: Use your emergency lights.
questions.explanation: Your horn should be used to warn other drivers or pedestrians in situations where they may not see you. For example, if you think another driver is about to hit you, you should sound your horn.

questions.question: Which of the following commonly causes traffic accidents?
questions.answerA: Inattentive driving
questions.answerB: Excessive speed under the driving conditions
questions.answerC: Following other vehicles too closely
questions.explanation: Driving too fast for conditions is a major cause of motor vehicle crashes. Being inattentive to surroundings can cause a driver to collide with other vehicles. Most rear-end collisions are caused by drivers following other vehicles too closely.

questions.question: Traffic signals sometimes display arrows to control turns from specific lanes. A green arrow:
questions.answerA: Is used only on one-way streets.
questions.answerB: Has the same meaning as a circular green traffic light, but traffic must turn in the direction indicated by the arrow.
questions.answerC: Means that you may proceed, but only if the green arrow is accompanied by a circular green light.
questions.answerD: Points the way to an airport.
questions.explanation: A green arrow has the same meaning as a circular green traffic light, but traffic in the indicated lane must turn in the direction shown by the arrow.

questions.question: You are driving at night and another vehicle is approaching from the opposite direction. Your headlights:
questions.answerA: Should be on their high beam setting.
questions.answerB: Should be on their low beam setting.
questions.answerC: Should be off. Use your parking lights.
questions.answerD: May be on either their high or low beam setting.
questions.explanation: Do not use your high beam headlights when approaching or following another vehicle at night. Switch to the low beam setting to ensure the safety of everyone on the road.

questions.question: If a flagger is directing traffic in a construction zone, you must:
questions.answerA: Follow the directions given by the flagger.
questions.answerB: Copy what surrounding traffic is doing, despite the flagger's instructions.
questions.answerC: Assume the flagger is not supposed to be directing traffic.
questions.answerD: Follow the laws that would be in place if the area was not under construction.
questions.explanation: Be prepared to reduce your speed and use caution when directed to do so by a sign, flagger, or law enforcement officer. Failure to do so is illegal and is dangerous to those working in construction zones.

questions.question: While backing, you should:
questions.answerA: Rely only on your mirrors.
questions.answerB: Flash your lights.
questions.answerC: Open your door to see if it is safe to proceed.
questions.answerD: Turn your head and look through the rear window.
questions.explanation: When intending to back up, always check behind your vehicle before getting in. Children and small objects are difficult to see from the driver’s seat. While backing, turn your head so you can see through the rear window. Do not depend only on your mirrors or sensors.

questions.question: Drivers who eat and drink while driving:
questions.answerA: Make no driving errors.
questions.answerB: Have trouble driving slowly.
questions.answerC: Are better drivers because they are not hungry.
questions.explanation: Choosing to eat, drink, or smoke while driving is dangerous because these actions require a driver to remove their hands from the wheel and their eyes from the road. Drivers who engage in distracting activities while driving have trouble staying in their lanes and controlling their vehicles.

questions.question: Many crashes are caused by:
questions.answerA: Drivers traveling too fast for conditions.
questions.answerB: Drivers consistently checking their mirrors and blind spots.
questions.answerC: Drivers yielding the right-of-way.
questions.answerD: Drivers maintaining a four-second following distance.
questions.explanation: Many crashes are caused by drivers who are driving too fast for conditions. Always drive within the legal speed limits and decrease your speed any time conditions are less than perfect.

questions.question: If an officer is directing traffic at a working traffic light, drivers should:
questions.answerA: Follow the directions indicated by the traffic light.
questions.answerB: Follow the directions given by the officer.
questions.answerC: Honk at the officer.
questions.answerD: Check to see what the cars next to them are doing.
questions.explanation: Traffic signals are placed at intersections to keep traffic moving and to help prevent crashes. Drivers, pedestrians, and cyclists must obey these signals, except in instances when an officer is directing traffic.

questions.question: If traffic signals at an intersection are not functioning due to a power outage:
questions.answerA: Park your vehicle as far off the road as possible and wait for power to be restored.
questions.answerB: Use hand signals to indicate your intentions to other drivers.
questions.answerC: Turn on your hazard lights and proceed through the intersection without stopping.
questions.answerD: Treat the intersection as a four-way stop.
questions.explanation: If a traffic light at an intersection is not functioning due to a power outage, yield to other drivers in the same manner as you would when approaching a four-way stop. When it is your turn, proceed through the intersection with caution.

questions.question: This is a ____ sign.
questions.answerA: Stop
questions.answerB: Wrong way
questions.answerC: Yield
questions.explanation: This triangular sign is a "Yield" sign. When you see this sign, you must slow down to check for traffic and yield the right-of-way to pedestrians and approaching cross traffic. Stop only if it is necessary to do so.

questions.question: A pedestrian starts to cross in front of your vehicle. You should:
questions.answerA: Flash your lights.
questions.answerB: Slow down.
questions.answerC: Speed up and pass in front of the pedestrian.
questions.answerD: Stop and let the pedestrian cross.
questions.explanation: Slow down and be prepared to stop whenever you see pedestrians walking on or crossing the roadway. Be particularly careful where children are present. Always yield the right-of-way to a pedestrian crossing in a crosswalk.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Curve ahead.
questions.answerB: Roadwork ahead.
questions.answerC: Merging traffic.
questions.explanation: Warning signs prepare drivers for upcoming road conditions and hazards and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign alerts drivers to an upcoming curve in the road.

questions.question: Alcoholic beverages will affect you:
questions.answerA: More rapidly after you have just eaten.
questions.answerB: More rapidly on an empty stomach.
questions.answerC: In the same way at all times.
questions.answerD: Only if you have more than two drinks.
questions.explanation: Alcohol can affect you differently at different times. Any amount of alcohol consumed on an empty stomach will affect you more rapidly than it does when you have just eaten. It is safest to refrain from driving when you have consumed alcohol in any quantity.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: One-way traffic.
questions.answerB: Divided highway ahead.
questions.answerC: Two-way traffic.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually diamond-shaped with black markings on a yellow background. They alert drivers to upcoming hazards. This warning sign indicates that drivers are about to encounter a divided highway.

questions.question: Night driving can be more difficult than driving during the day because:
questions.answerA: Cars overheat more quickly at night.
questions.answerB: Visibility is reduced in the dark.
questions.answerC: It is more likely to be raining at night.
questions.answerD: You are more likely to encounter a motorcycle at night.
questions.explanation: At night, your field of vision is reduced. To make sure you are able to react to hazards on the roadway, always use appropriate headlights. Drive slowly enough that you are able to stop within the distance that you can see ahead.

questions.question: An inattentive driver is a driver who:
questions.answerA: Stares at objects off the roadway or daydreams while driving.
questions.answerB: Maintains eye contact during a conversation with a passenger while driving.
questions.answerC: Only watches the vehicle ahead of their vehicle.
questions.explanation: Do not become distracted by looking at passengers, attempting to find something in your vehicle, looking at reading material, sightseeing, or daydreaming while driving. Continue scanning the road, checking your mirrors, and looking at the instrument panel at regular intervals. Developing these safe habits will keep you attentive as a driver.

questions.question: When getting ready to change lanes, you should:
questions.answerA: Check your side view mirror.
questions.answerB: Check your rearview mirror.
questions.answerC: Quickly turn your head to check for other vehicles.
questions.explanation: Before changing lanes, check your side and rearview mirrors for traffic approaching you from behind. Just before you begin moving into the other lane, quickly glance over your shoulder and check for any vehicles that may be in your blind spot.

questions.question: If you stop at a railroad crossing with more than one track:
questions.answerA: Wait to proceed until you have a clear view of all tracks.
questions.answerB: Stop on the first railroad track and watch for another train.
questions.answerC: Go through as soon as the train passes.
questions.answerD: Go through when one of the tracks is free.
questions.explanation: If you are stopped at a railroad crossing with more than one track, do not start moving as soon as a train passes. Wait until you have a clear view down all tracks before you start across. Even where there is only one track, do not start across immediately after a train passes; check again for another train that may be approaching.

questions.question: To pass a slower-moving vehicle on a two-lane, two-way road, you must:
questions.answerA: Not cross the centerline.
questions.answerB: Flash your lights at oncoming traffic.
questions.answerC: Use the shoulder.
questions.answerD: Use the lane that belongs to oncoming traffic.
questions.explanation: Passing on a two-lane, two-way road requires good judgment because you must use the lane belonging to oncoming traffic to complete your pass. Only pass if you may safely and legally do so.

questions.question: Allow a larger space cushion than usual when stopping:
questions.answerA: On an incline.
questions.answerB: At an intersection.
questions.answerC: At a stop sign.
questions.explanation: You should allow more space in front of your vehicle than usual when you are stopped on an uphill slope. If the vehicle in front of you rolls backward toward your vehicle when traffic begins to move again, it is less likely that there will be a collision.

questions.question: When driving in bad weather, drivers should:
questions.answerA: Increase their speed to reach their final destination more quickly.
questions.answerB: Decrease their following distance.
questions.answerC: Increase their following distance.
questions.explanation: When driving on wet roads, drivers should increase their following distance.

questions.question: You may park or stop along the shoulder of the freeway:
questions.answerA: As long as you turn on your four-way (emergency) flashers.
questions.answerB: If no part of your vehicle is on the road.
questions.answerC: If you need to look at a map for directions.
questions.answerD: Only if you have an emergency.
questions.explanation: It is prohibited to park on the shoulder of a freeway, except in an emergency.

questions.question: Which of the following must you obey over the other three?
questions.answerA: A steady red light
questions.answerB: A police officer
questions.answerC: A stop sign
questions.explanation: Directions given by traffic officers take precedence over signs, signals, and pavement markings. People authorized to direct traffic include police officers, fire police, highway work area flag persons, and school crossing persons.

questions.question: From top to bottom, the following is the proper order for traffic lights:
questions.answerA: Red, yellow, green.
questions.answerB: Red, green, yellow.
questions.answerC: Green, red, yellow.
questions.explanation: On a traffic signal arranged vertically, red is always on top and green on the bottom. When arranged horizontally, red is always on the left and green on the right.

questions.question: Before passing another vehicle, you should signal:
questions.answerA: Just before changing lanes.
questions.answerB: At any time.
questions.answerC: After changing lanes.
questions.answerD: Early enough for others to know your plans.
questions.explanation: Before passing, you should signal early enough for other drivers to know your plans in advance.

questions.question: Newer vehicles have equipment warning lamps installed on the instrument panel. Which of the following statements is correct?
questions.answerA: All lamps should be illuminated when the ignition switch is first turned on before the engine is started.
questions.answerB: No lamps should illuminate until the engine is running.
questions.answerC: The lamps should never illuminate unless there is a malfunction.
questions.answerD: The lamps will only illuminate if the headlights are turned on.
questions.explanation: Equipment warning lamps on a vehicle instrument panel should all be illuminated when the ignition switch is turned on. A warning lamp that is not illuminated when the ignition switch is turned on indicates that the lamp is not functioning.

questions.question: If two drivers arrive at the same time to an open intersection:
questions.answerA: The driver on the right has the right-of-way.
questions.answerB: The driver on the left has the right-of-way.
questions.answerC: One driver may continue driving without stopping.
questions.answerD: One driver should honk to indicate that they are giving up the right-of-way.
questions.explanation: If you arrive to an open intersection at the same time as a vehicle to your right, you should yield the right-of-way to that vehicle. You may then proceed when it is safe to do so.

questions.question: What does an orange-colored sign indicate?
questions.answerA: The start of a no passing zone.
questions.answerB: A railroad crossing is ahead.
questions.answerC: A school zone is ahead.
questions.explanation: Construction, maintenance, and emergency operations signs are generally orange with black symbols.

questions.question: A police officer asks you to take a test determining the amount of alcohol in your blood. You:
questions.answerA: Do not have to take the test if you can prove that you weren’t drinking
questions.answerB: Must take the test or risk losing your license.
questions.answerC: Do not have to take the test if you have not violated any traffic rule.
questions.answerD: Must take the test or risk a fine.
questions.explanation: Any person operating a motor vehicle in Hawaii consents to having their blood alcohol content (BAC) tested when requested by law enforcement. Refusing to take a chemical test will result in the revocation of your license for a minimum of one year.

questions.question: A solid yellow “X” over a traffic lane means:
questions.answerA: That drivers must move out of the indicated lane because it is about to be used by oncoming traffic.
questions.answerB: That drivers may drive regularly in the indicated lane.
questions.answerC: That the indicated lane is for left turns only.
questions.answerD: That drivers may use the indicated lane, but should drive with caution.
questions.explanation: Lane use control signals are used when the direction of the flow of traffic in a specific lane changes throughout the day. They are used to show which lanes of traffic are open and closed, as well as to show if toll booths are open or closed. A signal displaying a solid yellow “X” means that drivers must move out of the indicated lane because it is about to be used by oncoming traffic.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: You must turn left or right.
questions.answerB: You are approaching a T intersection.
questions.answerC: The road that you are on intersects with a divided highway.
questions.answerD: You are on an overpass above a divided highway.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that the road that you are on intersects with a divided highway. A divided highway is two one-way roadways separated by a median or guide rail.
